Title: Structural Engineer
Job Description:
Summary/objective:
DeSimone Consulting Engineers is seeking an Engineer with structural design experience on mid to high rise building projects.
The candidate will provide structural engineering design on a range of projects and assist a senior staff member in the completion of day to day projects. Work will include computer modeling of building foundation and superstructure systems, design of structural elements, preparation of structural drawings, and construction administration tasks. Responsibilities will include the application of standard engineering design principles and sound engineering judgment to accomplish work assignments. The candidate will keep clear records of all design calculations and work product.
Required Skills and Experience
Bachelor of Science Degree in Structural or Civil Engineering. Masters of Science degree a plus.
One or more years of relevant experience in structural analysis and design.
Knowledge of concrete, steel and masonry design codes, as well as local and national building codes required.
Knowledge of standard construction practices and the ability to work with contractors to address construction issues.
Ability to work in AutoCAD and Revit.
Strong verbal and written communications skills.
Detail oriented with strong people and team skills.

DeSimone is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Senior Structural Engineer
Job Description:
Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.

Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.


Your Impact:

At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other. Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow, and succeed.


We share a common purpose – to make the world more connected and sustainable. And we’re excited about the innovative ways we can change the world. If you are also interested in turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good, then Jacobs is where you belong. You will have the opportunity to grow professionally through challenging projects and working closely with our multi-discipline design teams, Senior Project Managers, and our clients.
We are looking for a passionate and dedicated Structural Engineer in Fresno, CA. Looking for a role where your engineering design will make an immediate impact on construction? The CA High Speed Rail – CP2-3 Project is a large-scale design-build project in Fresno, CA with on-going design and construction work. We are looking to fill a full-time Senior Structural Engineer position that will support the engineering Design Services During Construction (DSDC) effort in our project office located in Selma, CA office. This is the ideal role for a mid-to-senior level structural engineer that wants to work alongside the construction team as they build the project. Daily tasks will allow construction to proceed, resolve field issues, and coordinate with design team.
Review supplier product drawing submittals and construction shop drawings.
Review construction submittals and process through DSDC process
Engineer solutions to resolve Non-Conformance Reports (NCRs) for field issues
Coordinate with design engineer-of-record regarding field Request for Information (RFI) responses
Prepare construction as-builts
Performs complex engineering tasks and particularly important engineering work efficiently and accurately.
Extracts engineering information from CAD drawings.
Prepares engineering computations, material quantity takeoffs, estimates, surveys, and designs.
Completes a variety of assignments such as drawings, specifications, and other materials suitable for construction purposes.
Frequently interfaces with other Engineering disciplines as well as construction team.
Prepares and issues specifications, data sheets, and other construction documents.
Provides technical guidance to CAD Designer/Drafters, Designers, and lower-level Engineers working on the same project.
May be required to provide the seal and signature of the professional engineer, as appropriate, ensuring compliance with all applicable codes, regulations, and ordinances.
May act in an advisory capacity to senior management personnel on engineering related matters.
At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.

Here’s What You’ll Need:

Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering with a Structural emphasis
Proficiency in utilizing CAD and other PC software packages typically associated with engineering is required.
Familiarity with Caltrans standard plans, Caltrans bridge design manual and memo to designers is desirable
Knowledge of reinforced concrete design, prestressed and post tensioned concrete design
Knowledge of deep foundations design, repair and analysis for CIDH piles and drilled shafts
Practical knowledge of reinforcement detailing and rebar shop drawings review
Practical knowledge of post tensioning system shop drawings and interpretation of field elongation measurements according to Caltrans Specifications
Familiarity with standard practice products in bridge construction and repair procedures
Knowledge of concrete mix design per ACI and AASHTO
Familiarity with quality control activities such as pre-pour inspections, etc.
Ability to review workplans prepared by the construction team and understanding the means and methods of construction
Familiarity with falsework design and temporary SOE systems during construction staging
Strong communications and interdisciplinary coordination are required
Jacobs health and welfare benefits are designed to invest in you, and in the things you care about. Your health. Your well-being. Your security. Your future. Typical benefits offered include flexible work schedules and opportunities to work remotely, educational reimbursement, retirement benefits, employee stock purchase plan, health benefits, disability benefits, life and accident insurance, voluntary benefits, paid time off and paid holidays, and parental leave.
Typical salary range for this position is $100,700 to $190,450 , and is commensurate with experience relative to the position.

At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.

Title: Structural Engineer
Job Description:
Structural Engineer
Kline Engineering & Consulting, LLC (KLINE) is a growing structural engineering consulting firm with offices in Manassas, VA, Charlotte, NC and North Miami, Florida. We are the premier expert in the country providing design of post-tensioned concrete structures including design of podiums, parking structures, and mix use residential buildings. Our work is the result of decades of expertise and experience combined with state-of-the-art technology.
We bring 30 years of expertise, +3K projects, and passion to bear on every building project to deliver smarter, safer, more cost-efﬁcient, and constructible designs setting the foundation for our clients’ success. We specialize in the design of new post-tensioned concrete structures; structural evaluation, restoration, strengthening services; construction engineering; and specialty post-tensioning consulting.
Sound interesting? How would you like to join our team?
We are currently seeking an entry level Structural Engineer for our Charlotte, North Carolina office.
The candidate will possess the following:
BS degree with emphasis on structural design.
Good knowledge of concrete, steel, and wood design.
Knowledge in AutoCAD and Revit is a plus
Positive team-oriented work style.
Driven and self-motivated.
Excellent written and oral communication skills. Bilingual-Spanish desirable.

Ability to have fun while working with your team in a face paced environment.
Candidate must be comfortable with a growing entrepreneurial work environment.
Legally able to work in the United States. This is a direct-hire and in-person position for our office in Charlotte, NC. This is not a remote position.
General functions:
Assists the drafting engineering unit.
Handles RFI's, submittals, process all Change Orders and billing of invoices, etc.
Prepares technical and engineering correspondence and reports.
Designs new commercial, residential, institutional buildings, and parking structures. The work will include condition assessments of existing structures and design of repair and strengthening strategies.
We have a unique culture that emphasizes leadership, integrity, respect, relationships, education, and work ethic. And although we are serious about our work, we promote and encourage having fun in and out of the workplace. We are driven by our commitment to our core values, and we live by our motto "Build Smarter. Build Stronger.”

KLINE offers a competitive compensation package with a full range of benefits including health/dental/vision insurance, life insurance, long-term and short-term disability insurance, parental leave, 401K, culture of recognition, tuition assistance, continuous training, and career development, 8 paid holidays, personal time off, volunteer and employees internal events, flexible and work remotely options available, and vacation.

Title: Structural Development Engineer
Job Description:
Chris-Craft is a premium boat manufacturer participating in the luxury goods industry looking for an enthusiastic Engineer who wants to be part of a great team building a world-class product.
We are looking for someone with a track record of coming into new organizations and winning the respect and admiration of the workforce in manufacturing. Your style is one of helping, coaching, encouraging, and motivating employees as the company grows and makes a transition to a more sophisticated environment.
As a Structural Development Engineer, you will be responsible for researching, generating, developing, and implementing mechanical, laminate and structural system designs for all Chris-Craft products.
If you've been looking for the opportunity to be part of a company that is rapidly growing, you welcome challenges and work well as part of a team or on you own, then look no further.
Responsible for researching, generating, developing, and implementing mechanical, laminate, and structural system designs for all Chris Craft products. Engineering will be performed to ensure designs are robust and manufacturing friendly. These systems must meet all necessary internal quality and supplier requirements and be executed to meet industry and regulatory requirements.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Ensure reliable engineering and integration of boat systems to include but not limited to laminates, structural design/analysis, surface modeling, component development, and structural analysis.
Development of new product ideas and systems in a form of 2D drawings and 3D CAD models prior to physical execution
Generate engineering drawings for new designs and build process.
Generate Bill of Material listings for parts and systems engineered to be used to populate the ERP database.
Participate in manufacturing integration activities to ensure successful launches of new products and technologies as well as continuous improvement activities.
Ensure timely and adequate completion of all applicable phases of projects
Track new and revised composite parts from first articles though attainment of production rates.
Monitor build schedule changes and ensure interdepartmental communication.
Ensure that designs meet all supplier, regulatory and internal quality standards, and specifications.
Ensure that new designs and components meet the cost, performance, and functional requirements of the new and enhancement boat programs.
Ensure that raw material and component suppliers are consulted with during design and during the resolution of technical issues.
Provide accurate material and component specification for the sourcing of new and replacement components.
Ensure that all materials used in the manufacture of finished products have been tested and approved for quality and reliability.
Generate, review, and approve engineering change notice’s (ECN) as required.
Resolve assigned Engineering Change Requests (ECRs) to make production driven improvements.
Support manufacturing and customer service on issues resolution
Ensure that designs have been fully validated, are production appropriate, meet necessary system specifications and performance requirements.
Utilize warranty data to identify issues related to structural systems for mitigation purposes.
Provide technical evaluations and reports on issues for customer service and field problems.
Ensure compliance with all necessary industry, domestic and international government regulations.
Perform material testing, final system design and structural verification tests as needed and capture and communicate technical details and results.
Troubleshoot lamination quality issues and identify process improvement opportunities.
Patterning, digitizing, and programming laminate materials for CNC processing.
Maintaining technical information in an organized and accessible way.
Self-starter, high energy individual who can work effectively without supervision.
Know and enforce company policies and procedures.
Must be willing to travel (minimum 10%).
Education/Training
Bachelor's Degree in (Mechanical Engineering, Composite Engineering, Ocean Engineering, Marine Engineering, Naval Architecture, related discipline) required
Consideration will be given for candidates with significant work experience in lieu of education requirements
Experience and Skills
3-5 years experience in marine product design preferred with knowledge of production processes.
CAD experience; Rhino , Sigmanest, and/or AutoCAD preferred
3-D modeling skills required
ABYC or ACMA Composites Certification preferred
Composites experience and knowledge of industry best practices required
CNC file programming/processing skills preferred
Finite Element Analysis (FEA) preferred
Lean Six Sigma certification or experience is a plus
Commitment to quality and standards that are accepted by the industry
Must interface well with other employee’s and departments throughout Chris Craft as well as outside vendors, dealers and retail customers
Must be able to work extra hours required to assume timely completion of critical projects
Proficiency in PC based tools with a focus on Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, email and general web-based applications.
Problem solving and decision-making abilities
Must be willing to work in the manufacturing environment and be hands on to support manufacturing and prototype activities
Process conscious critical thinking skills with strengths in problem solving and root cause analysis

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer as well as a drug-free workplace. All offers of employment are contingent upon the successful completion of a pre-employment drug screen and background screen.

Title: Civil Design Engineer
Job Description:
At Meyer our people power who we are! We take great pride in what we build.
Come be a part of an ever growing company with infinite opportunities for advancement. As an Engineer, you will be designing structures that contribute to the improvement and advancement of the Country's electrical infrastructure. These utility structures help provide access to new and existing power sources all throughout the United States. The future of our industry is bright!

With Meyer, you join the innovators in developing, designing, and fabricating multi-sided tubular steel transmission poles, the first to use corrosion-resistant weathering steel, the first to utilize full-scale vertical testing, and the first to develop wood-equivalent steel poles. We were the first to design and fabricate 500kV and 765kV single-circuit tubular poles, and the first steel transmission manufacturer to become ISO certified. Our highly experienced, in-house team of engineers has helped author many current industry standards and specifications. Engineering solutions for voltages up to 765kV are designed with our proprietary software and validated through years of comprehensive, real-world testing.

Meyer Utility Structures, an Arcosa subsidiary, is searching for a Civil Design Engineer at our Memphis, TN or Fort Worth, TX office! The Engineer is responsible for the analysis and design of tubular steel transmission structures and associated products to be in conformance with project design criteria, applicable industry standards and Meyer Utility Structures policies, procedures and design standards. The Engineer will coordinate and communicate technical information and requirements with internal and external customers and will prepare complete and accurate designs, details, documentation and reports for assigned projects. The Engineer will assist in resolving technical issues on drawings, in fabrication and construction as needed.
What You’ll do:
Review customer specifications and project design criteria
Using computer programs, design tools, engineering documents and structural engineering fundamentals, analyze and design structures and appurtenances to meet customer specifications and project design criteria.
Prepares design calculations and cost estimating information.
Review drawings for design conformance and customer revisions. Coordinates customer design revisions with project management, modeling and estimating.
Resolves problems of ambiguity during Drafting of Shop Drawings.
Reports the impact of design changes to the Project Manager.
As needed, performs checks of projects designed by other Engineers.


What You’ll need:
Bachelors of Science in Civil Engineering with background in Structural Design or equivalent work experience that provides knowledge and exposure to fundamental theories, principles and concepts
E.I.T preferred
Steel Design coursework strongly preferred
Theoretical understanding of Basic Structural Engineering fundamentals
Ability to work as part of a team

We Build What Matters

OVERVIEW OF ROLE

The job holder should have knowledge and training related to structural design and analysis of structures within Marine and/or Oil and Gas industry.

SPECIFIC KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & ACTIVITIES
Provide skills, integrity, and knowledge in key areas of structural engineering, including design codes, legislative requirements, and current good engineering practice.
Undertake responsibility for production of deliverables, which may include preparation and checking of design reports, engineering support to Drawing Office, design calculations, specifications, procedures, analyses, and various third-party submissions.
Provide structural stability and integrity calculations for subsea structures (PLETs, Jumpers, Suction Piles etc.). Design to resist forces for in-service, installation, and transportation load conditions. Determination of size, shape, strength, and type of structural members.
Design and detailing in accordance with acknowledged industry Codes, Standards and Design Guides (e.g. API, DNV, AISC); Client Specifications and Scopes of Work
Production and checking of design documentation including feasibility reports, detailed design reports, equipment specifications etc.
Production of specifications, data sheets and MTOs
Provide stress analysis utilizing STAAD Pro, CAESAR, ANSYS or similar software
Coordinate structural engineering support to the execution of multi-discipline projects in line with defined budget and schedule
Liaise with associated related disciplines and understand the interfaces within a project
Provide structural engineering assistance during occasional periods of offshore or site working
Contribute as required to events such as Kickoff meetings, HIRAs, Design Reviews, etc.
Actively participate in relevant training to pursue continuing professional development
AUTHORITY/DIMENSIONS
Operate within the Business Code of Conduct
Operate according to Subsea 7’s Management Principles
Support standards and procedures for the Engineering Function

PERSON SPECIFICATION

Essential Experience, Skills and Knowledge:
Professional qualifications – Degree qualified ideally in Civil/Structural or Mechanical Engineering. (Demonstrable experience in a similar role will also be considered)
Relevant engineering experience (3-6 years) in the design of structures within the Marine and/or Oil and Gas industry
Awareness of marine classification and local legislation (Essential)
Can work within time/budget constraints
Presents self in a professional manner appropriate to the role
Produces work of presentable quality
Ability to prioritize and organize work
Identifies industry codes, standards, and design guidelines.
Deliver stress analysis work on project
Ability to support package engineering and management
Sound Knowledge of STAAD Pro, CAESAR and ANSYS or similar software

Title: Precast Design/Structural Engineer
Job Description:
Gage Brothers Concrete Products is looking for a design engineer to add to our growing company. You can work remotely from your home, while still being connected to a motivated and energetic team!
Responsible for architectural and structural engineering for prestressed/precast concrete projects. Review and red-line drawings and specifications.
Work closely with other company departments to promote a strong working relationship as well as develop and maintain relationships with external engineers, architects, contractors, and vendors.
Demonstrate knowledge of the schedule for all project phases and follow-up with customers (internal and external) to make sure needs are met in a timely manner.
Create pre-bid designs. Assist the sales department in providing valued solutions and technical expertise to our clients.
Provide timely solutions to manufacturing facility and clients as needed.
Train engineers of lesser experience on Gage Brothers standards.
Gage Brothers Concrete Products is a Employee Owned, Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.
Benefits Include: Insurance (Health, Life, Dental, Vision, Short-Term Disability), Wellness Program, Counseling Services, Paid Holidays-Including Team Member Birthday, Paid Time Off, 401(k), Boot Reimbursement Program, and Employee Stock Ownership Program.
We pride ourselves in being innovators and early-adopters of the latest industry technology. We would love to take you for a tour of our new manufacturing facility and talk about the plans we have for the future. You can be part of developing new products and market sectors. Our team is driven and diverse. Our goal is to make our customers’ lives easier and have fun doing it.
Requirements
Licensed P.E. with 3+ years’ experience in precast concrete design.
Knowledgeable in PCI Design Handbook, IBC, ACI 318, AISC 360, ASCE-7, and other applicable code documents.
Revit experience is preferred.
Travel to our office in Sioux Falls, SD occasionally
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: From $105,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Schedule:
8 hour shift
License/Certification:
Professional Engineer License (Required)
Work Location: Remote

Health insurance

Title: Forensic Structural or Civil Engineer
Job Description:
As a Forensic Structural Engineer with U.S. Forensic you will:
Perform inspections of residential and commercial buildings to determine the cause of damages which may include damages from improper design, improper construction, storm related damages, misuse or lack of maintenance.
Work from your home office about 66% of the time and conduct site visits about 33% of the time. You will not be required to go to an office location.
Set your own schedule while working a 40-hour week which includes travel time to sites with only occasional overtime.
Travel to site visits that are mostly local to you, with only occasional overnight travel.
Not just sit at a desk all week but perform inspections that involve physical activity.
Write professional, concise reports that require analytical abilities.
Be part of an organization with a wide range of Forensic Engineering expertise and Metallurgy, Chemical Analysis, Materials Testing, Weld Testing, Roof Inspection, Electron Microscopy, Seismic Testing, Environmental Testing, Computed Tomography, Calibration and Non-Destructive Testing capabilities.
Be part of a rapidly growing organization with around 150 Professional Engineers across many disciplines.
Gain knowledge through structured third-party training, on the job training and a mentorship program.
Have competitive compensation and competitive benefits program including company paid full Medical, Dental, STD, LTD, Life and AD&D insurance. Company paid 401K retirement program with 50% matching up to 5%. Licenses, Memberships and PDH credits are covered by the company. Partnerships are considered after demonstrating outstanding company and customer service.
Since its inception in 2006, U.S. Forensic has performed thousands of forensic engineering evaluations throughout the US to determine the origin and cause of a loss and the extent of damages. Inspections have included various machinery and heavy equipment, commercial and passenger vehicles, residential and commercial buildings, roadways, and marine structures. Visit our website at www.usforensic.com view our service offerings.
U.S. Forensic is a subsidiary of Applied Technical Services. Founded in 1967, Applied Technical Services has established a reputation with business, industry, and the legal profession for successfully uncovering facts in Metallurgy and Materials Testing, Chemical Analysis, Non-destructive Testing, Forensic and Consulting Engineering, Fire and Explosion Investigations, and Calibration Services. ATS has over 1,200 employees in over 50 Locations, over $170,000,000 in annual revenue and 17 subsidiary companies. Our vision is to become the industry leader in providing expert consulting & forensic engineering, testing, testing inspection and calibration services.
Professional Engineer License in Structural or Civil Engineering.
Ability to analyze various residential and commercial building failures to determine causation.
Ability to write professional, concise reports.
Experience with any of the following: forensic engineering, residential construction, commercial construction, code enforcement, code inspection, roofing, facilities maintenance, materials testing, home inspections, expert witness testimony, residential design, or storm damage assessments.
Ability to conduct inspections that will require climbing ladders, entering confined spaces, working on roof tops, etc.
EOE/AA/M/F/Vet/Disability
U.S. Forensic and Applied Technical Services are equal opportunity employers where employment is based upon personal capabilities and qualifications without discrimination due to race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other protected characteristic as established by law.

Title: Structural Engineer
Job Description:
Our firm is looking to add an engineering position to support its continued growth. The successful applicant must be a licensed structural engineer who also possesses knowledge of building envelope sciences, along with fall protection and building maintenance systems.

Specific skills and duties would include:

Communicating effectively and professionally with clients, project managers, internal staff, and contractors.
Ability to implement forensic investigations with regard to building envelope assemblies.
Analyzing and designing fall protection and building maintenance systems.
Assessing existing building structural systems for seismic upgrade, roof replacement projects, and fall protection systems.

We offer a full benefit package and open work environment; salary is commensurate with experience. Interested candidates should send a cover letter and resume to: info@professionalroofconsultants.com

please email your resume with cover letter to: info@professionalroofconsultants.com

Title: ENTRY-LEVEL CIVIL ENGINEER
Job Description:
POSITION
We are currently seeking a full-time Entry-Level Civil Engineer to join any of our four Wisconsin office locations.
At JT, our goal is to provide a versatile career involving both construction and design experience. We strongly believe that gaining experience in all aspects of civil engineering results in more well-rounded engineers. This is an excellent opportunity for growth as we continue to expand our services and markets.
When you join our team, you’ll be provided with a challenging but fun work environment with unlimited career opportunities.
ABOUT US
At JT we pride ourselves on being REAL people, providing TRUSTED solutions with PROVEN results. It’s in our DNA, it’s why we continue to attract the top talent in the industry, and it’s why clients turn to us to deliver their projects.
JT is proud to offer the experience, resources, and services of a larger firm, combined with the cost-effectiveness, client focus, and regional knowledge of a local firm. We view each project as a partnership and strive to make our clients’ needs, timelines, goals, and concerns our top priority.
Founded in 2005, we have grown to over 85 employees with office locations in Green Bay, Madison, Chippewa Falls, and Milwaukee, Wisconsin. We provide a tailored approach for each project, proactively engaging and communicating with our clients to ensure efficient and cost-effective service. Our portfolio includes projects at every scale, from small bridge rehabilitation projects to mega interstate highway expansion projects. Our design and construction professionals work closely together, utilizing our combined experience, knowledge, and expertise to deliver award-winning, economical designs that exceed our clients’ expectations.
We serve public and private sector clients in the areas of transportation, municipal, stormwater, and structural engineering, in addition to surveying and construction management.
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES
Conduct engineering design under the supervision of an experienced engineer
Perform construction management duties under the supervision of an experienced engineer
Perform project responsibilities while applying civil engineering techniques, procedures, and principles
Improve project processes by identifying inefficiencies and recommending solutions
Establish and maintain effective working relationships with other employees, clients, and public agencies
Demonstrate strong attention to detail, accuracy, and thoroughness
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering or related field
0-4 years of experience
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Solid organizational and time management skills
Self-disciplined/motivated individual who also works well in a team environment
Valid driver’s license and use of a personal vehicle for travel between job sites
Physically able to perform work in the field
Legally authorized to work permanently (i.e., without time limitations, without restrictions or need for work sponsorship) in the country where this position is located
PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS
Engineer-in-Training (EIT) or Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) preferred
Prior internship and/or related experience preferred
Experience with design software including Civil 3D and/or MicroStation
BENEFITS
Our benefits are competitive, and so are we when it comes to hiring. Aside from what’s listed below, you’ll find that we set ourselves apart from the competition with the emphasis we place on employee culture. When you join JT, you’ll join a team with shared values, belief systems, and attitudes who are as passionate about what they do as they are about the people they work with.
JT offers competitive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurances to all full-time employees upon date of hire
We also offer an HRA to help cover medical deductible costs and an FSA for dependent care needs
We offer a 401K retirement savings plan with a company match starting date of hire
Additional benefits include:
In-house wellness program to encourage overall well-being in and outside the workplace
Regular company and team socials to encourage a tight-knit workplace
Flexible hours and remote work to best suit candidate’s needs
Collaborative work environment
JT ENGINEERING, INC. IS AN EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
Land Development Civil Engineer
Municipal Project Manager
Civil Engineering Intern (Summer 2023)

Title: Structural Design Engineer - Denver
Job Description:
Description:

We are looking for a Design Engineer to join our team in Denver, CO. (We have additional opportunities in Kansas City, MO too!) This early to mid career-level role is an exciting opportunity to grow your skills as an engineer and advance your project management skills. For this position, we are specifically looking for a Design Engineer interested in tackling commercial and residential projects as the exact focus of the position is to be determined based on need. Flexibility is an essential quality for this position.
As a Design Engineer, you’ll start by learning the in’s and out’s of Apex’s design standards. From there, you will move onto mastering work requiring the application of both standard structural engineering techniques. You will work under the supervision of an Apex Project Manager with the goal of developing your applied engineering skills. Our projects use all types of construction materials, and no two projects area never the same. You’ll probably pick up some commercial work here and there as well- this is a job with a lot of variety.
We are excited to find someone ready to be a part of our culture of learning which offers excellent long-term career development and growth opportunities. To be a successful candidate in this position, you must demonstrate intermediate to advanced skills in Revit as our engineers manage their own Revit files.
Day-to-Day Responsibilities
Plan preparation, designs, calculations for residential and/or commercial construction projects requiring basic, regular and repeated solutions.
Works on a few, small projects at a time, adhering to deadlines.
Structural analysis and design of new and existing structural systems.
Completes reports, structural calculations and technical documentation.
Utilizes AutoCAD and Revit to complete 2D and 3D designs.
Prepares detailed design drawings
Completes shop drawing reviews, truss certifications, and i-joist certifications.
Responds to all RFIs within 24 hours.
Complete site visits as needed on assigned projects and document finding. This includes taking adequate notes and making all necessary measurements and sketches to record field conditions and conversations.
Coordinates with the client, coworkers, contractors, suppliers, and others to gather project information.
Communicates with clients, supervisors and others on project status.
Performs in a teamwork environment.
Recommends ways to improve process, quality and coordination efforts.
Monitors their own hours and progress towards project completion.
Initiates project billing at appropriate milestones.
Completes timesheet on a daily basis to ensure project accuracy.
Corrects all in-house review comments within two attempts after receiving feedback from reviewer.
Employment with Apex Engineers, Inc. is at will. This means your employment is for an indefinite period of time and it is subject to termination by you or Apex, with or without cause, with or without notice, and at any time. Nothing in this job description or any other policy of Apex shall be interpreted to be in conflict with or to eliminate or modify in any way, the at will employment status of Apex employees.
Qualifications / Typical Experience
Experience in computer applications for engineering design (AutoCAD, Revit, RISA, etc)
Prior internship and/or post-bachelors work related structural consulting experience preferred.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
Able to effectively handle multiple projects.
Salary Information:
Salary for this position depends on the experience and certifications you bring into the role.
EIT with 0-2 years of structural design experience for vertical construction projects ($60,000-$72,500)
EIT with 3-4+ years of structural design experience for vertical construction projects ($70,000-$80,000)
PE/SE with structural design experience for vertical construction projects ($75,000-$85,000+)
Requirements:
Education Requirements
Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Civil, Architectural or Structural Engineering required.
2+ years of post-bachelor's experience in structural engineering (preferred)
Minimum of a 3.0 GPA strongly preferred.
Other Requirements
Candidates must be legally authorized to work permanently (i.e. without time limitations, without restrictions or without need for work sponsorship) in the United States.
Disclaimer
Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. This description reflects management’s assignment of essential functions, it does not proscribe or restrict the tasks that may be assigned. This job description is subject to change at any time.

Title: Civil Engineer (Structural)
Job Description:
Duties
Performs professional engineering duties related to a wide variety of structural engineering features pertinent to the new construction and/or modifications.
Develops design details of structural features for structures such as navigation locks, floodwalls, floodgates, control structures, pumping stations, ports, harbors, and bridges, determining the engineering principles that apply.
Coordinates assigned projects with other engineers and interested professional personnel of the district for the review of drawings, specifications, design documentation reports, and engineering appendices of feasibility reports.
Makes on-site visits for inspections of proposed construction sites to determine solutions for potential or actual problem areas.
Reviews construction submittals and design studies for compliance with specifications, completeness and approved design criteria.
Makes recommendation on required repairs to ensure the integrity of project features and to ensure conformance with policy requirements.
Provides advice, guidance, and recommendations on structural engineering to engineers, engineering technicians, and other District personnel.
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
Appointment may be subject to a suitability or fitness determination, as determined by a completed background investigation.
Qualifications
Who May Apply: US Citizens

In order to qualify, you must meet the education and experience requirements described below. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student; social). You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience; if qualifying based on education, your transcripts will be required as part of your application. Additional information about transcripts is in this document.

Basic Requirement for Engineer: A. Degree: Bachelor's degree (or higher degree) in engineering. To be acceptable, the program must: (1) lead to a bachelor's degree (or higher degree) in a school of engineering with at least one program accredited by the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET);OR (2) include differential and integral calculus and courses (more advanced than first-year physics and chemistry) in five of the following seven areas of engineering science or physics: (a) statics, dynamics; (b) strength of materials (stress-strain relationships); (c) fluid mechanics, hydraulics; (d) thermodynamics; (e) electrical fields and circuits; (f) nature and properties of materials (relating particle and aggregate structure to properties); and (g) any other comparable area of fundamental engineering science or physics, such as optics, heat transfer, soil mechanics, or electronics.

OR

B. Combination of Education and Experience: College-level education, training, and/or technical experience that furnished (1) a thorough knowledge of the physical and mathematical sciences underlying engineering, and (2) a good understanding, both theoretical and practical, of the engineering sciences and techniques and their applications to one of the branches of engineering. The adequacy of such background must be demonstrated by one of the following:

1. Professional registration or licensure - Current registration as an Engineer Intern (EI), Engineer in Training (EIT), or licensure as a Professional Engineer (PE) by any State, the District of Columbia, Guam, or Puerto Rico. Absent other means of qualifying under this standard, those applicants who achieved such registration by means other than written test (e.g., State grandfather or eminence provisions) are eligible only for positions that are within or closely related to the specialty field of their registration. For example, an applicant who attains registration through a State Board's eminence provision as a manufacturing engineer typically would be rated eligible only for manufacturing engineering positions.

2. Written Test - Evidence of having successfully passed the Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) examination, or any other written test required for professional registration, by an engineering licensure board in the various States, the District of Columbia, Guam, or Puerto Rico.

3. Specified academic courses - Successful completion of at least 60 semester hours of courses in the physical, mathematical, and engineering sciences and that included the courses specified in A above. The courses must be fully acceptable toward meeting the requirements of an engineering program.

4. Related curriculum - Successful completion of a curriculum leading to a bachelor's degree in an appropriate scientific field, e.g., engineering technology, physics, chemistry, architecture, computer science, mathematics, hydrology, or geology, may be accepted in lieu of a degree in engineering, provided the applicant has had at least 1 year of professional engineering experience acquired under professional engineering supervision and guidance. Ordinarily there should be either an established plan of intensive training to develop professional engineering competence, or several years of prior professional engineering-type experience, e.g., in interdisciplinary positions.

In addition to meeting one of the basic education requirements above, to qualify for this position you must also meet the experience requirements listed below.

Specialize Experience: One year of Specialized experience is defined as conducting structural engineering work related to dam and levee safety or other large civil works projects; participating in or leading teams in development of structural design products; addressing dam and levee safety deficiencies; producing documentation of design; producing construction plans and specifications; and participating in risk informed dam and levee safety modification studies or risk informed modifications to large civil work projects. This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the next lower grade/level position in the federal service (GS-11). For this grade level, you must meet the qualification requirement using experience alone-no substitution of education for experience is permitted.
Education
FOREIGN EDUCATION: If you are using education completed in foreign colleges or universities to meet the qualification requirements, you must show the education credentials have been evaluated by a private organization that specializes in interpretation of foreign education programs and such education has been deemed equivalent to that gained in an accredited U.S. education program; or full credit has been given for the courses at a U.S. accredited college or university. For further information, visit: http://www.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ous/international/usnei/us/edlite-visitus-forrecog.html
Additional information
Male applicants born after December 31, 1959, must complete a Pre-Employment Certification Statement for Selective Service Registration.
You will be required to provide proof of U.S. Citizenship.
One year trial/probationary period may be required.
Direct Deposit of Pay is required.
Selection is subject to restrictions resulting from Department of Defense referral system for displaced employees.
If you have retired from federal service and you are interested in employment as a reemployed annuitant, see the information in the Reemployed Annuitant information sheet.
This is a Career Program (CP) 18- Engineers and Scientist position.
Multiple positions may be filled from this announcement.
Salary includes applicable locality pay and Local Market Supplement.
Interagency Career Transition Assistance Program (ICTAP). If you are a Federal employee in the competitive service and your agency has notified you in writing that you are a displaced employee eligible for ICTAP consideration, you may receive selection priority for this position. To receive selection priority, you must: (1) meet ICTAP eligibility criteria (2) be rated well-qualified for the position and; (3) submit the appropriate documentation to support your ICTAP eligibility. To be considered well-qualified and receive selection priority applicants must satisfy all qualification requirements for the position and receive a score of 90 or above. Additional information about the program is on OPM's Career Transition Resources website.
When you perform a Civilian Permanent Change of Station (PCS) with the government, the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) considers the majority of your entitlements to be taxable. Visit https://www.dfas.mil/civilianemployees/civrelo/Civilian-Moving-Expenses-Tax-Deduction.htm for more information.
If you are unable to apply online or need to fax a document you do not have in electronic form, view the following link for information regarding an Alternate Application.
Permanent Change of Station (PCS) allowances may be authorized, subject to the provisions of the Joint Travel Regulations and an agency determination that a PCS move is in the Government Interest.
Relocation/Recruitment incentive MAY BE authorized up to 25% to highly qualified candidate. Must sign a service agreement if incentive(s) is/are authorized.
Due to COVID-19, the agency is currently in an expanded telework posture. If selected, you may be expected to temporarily telework, even if your home is located outside the local commuting area. Once employees are permitted to return to the office, you will be expected to report to the duty station listed on this announcement within a designated time frame identified by the organization. At that time, you may be eligible to request to continue to telework one or more days a pay period depending upon the terms of the agency's telework policy.
Information may be requested regarding the vaccination status of selectees for the purposes of implementing workplace safety protocols. For more information, visit https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/faq/vaccinations/.

As described above, your complete application includes your resume, your responses to the online questionnaire, and documents which prove your eligibility to apply. If you fail to provide these documents, you will be marked as having an incomplete application package and you will not be considered any further.

1. Your resume:
Your resume may be submitted in any format and must support the specialized experience described in this announcement.
If your resume includes a photograph or other inappropriate material or content, it will not be used to make eligibility and qualification determinations and you may not be considered for this vacancy.
For qualifications determinations your resume must contain hours worked per week and the dates of employment (i.e., HRS per week and month/year to month/year or month/year to present). If your resume does not contain this information, your application may be marked as incomplete and you may not receive consideration for this position.
For additional information see: What to include in your resume.
2. Other supporting documents:
Cover Letter, optional
Most recent Performance Appraisal, if applicable
This position requires a job-related license or certification. You MUST submit a copy of your license or certification with your application package or you will be rated ineligible. See: Transcripts and Licenses
NOTE: Documents submitted as part of the application package, to include supplemental documents, may be shared beyond the Human Resources Office. Some supplemental documents such as military orders and marriage certificates may contain personal information for someone other than you. You may sanitize these documents to remove another person's personal information before you submit your application. You may be asked to provide an un-sanitized version of the documents if you are selected to confirm your eligibility.
If you are relying on your education to meet qualification requirements:
Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education in order for it to be credited towards qualifications. Therefore, provide only the attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.
Failure to provide all of the required information as stated in this vacancy announcement may result in an ineligible rating or may affect the overall rating.

Title: Entry Level Civil Engineer
Job Description:
Take Your Design Career to the Next Level
Are you ready to be challenged, make a difference, and experience professional growth in your career? Kleinfelder's Design team is looking for you! From bridge and structural engineering to civil, electrical, mechanical, and process engineering, Kleinfelder's collaborative Design Services create synergy across multiple disciplines.

Step into Your New Role
Our Boston, Westborough MA or Rocky Hill, CT office is looking for a Civil Engineer with Transportation, Roadway/Highway, and civil site design experience to join our growing team. This position will allow for remote work but may require field work in Massachusetts.
Ideal candidates for this civil engineering position will possess 0-2 years' experience in civil engineering.
This is a fantastic opportunity to work on a variety of civil engineering design and construction projects. We provide solutions to our clients to meet all of their civil engineering, transportation and roadway/highway design needs. Our solutions are forward thinking as we consider the impacts of climate change to our infrastructure needs. Great projects are not the only positive aspect of this role though. You will also work with a talented team of professionals with sought after experience in engineering expertise. Join our team where you can grow a career, become a leader, and maintain a healthy work/life balance.
Candidates must have a strong work ethic and an interest in working in the civil engineering field. Specific requirements of this job include:
B.S. or M.S/M.Eng. in Civil Engineering.
Engineering-In-Training is a plus, but all motivated individuals are encouraged to apply.
Candidates must possess excellent organizational, communication, computer, and technical writing skills.
0-2 years of civil engineering experience required with a focus on civil engineering preferred.
Strong AutoCAD and GIS skills preferred; willingness to learn required.
Candidates must have a strong work ethic and an interest in working in the civil engineering field. Additional requirements of this position will include:
Experience with aspects of roadway design including alignments, profiles, cross sections, slopes and grading, development of construction documents, and construction support services.
Experience with roadway/highway designs for municipalities and State Departments of Transportation.
Experience with the Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Connecticut and/or Maine Departments of Transportation is helpful.

Move Forward with Kleinfelder
Kleinfelder has been connecting great people to the best work since 1961. We are engineers, scientists, and construction professionals providing solutions that improve our clients' transportation, water, energy, and other private infrastructure. As a responsive, cross-disciplinary team of bright, curious, and innovative problem-solvers, we are dedicated to doing the right thing, every day, on every project from over 85 offices in the US, Canada, and Australia. Connecting great people to the best work is our purpose - together, we deliver.

Progress with an Employer that Values You
Kleinfelder is an inclusive organization free from discrimination. We are a stronger organization when we are a diverse workforce and believe that through diversity, equity, and inclusion comes creativity, innovation, and unity. We are proud to offer the following:

Benefits: Kleinfelder offers an excellent compensation and benefits package, including: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k) plan, and paid holidays.

Career Development: We are committed to investing in the professional development of our staff, offering each employee every opportunity to grow, develop, and take control of their career paths. We support these efforts through reimbursements for continuing education as well as many of the expenses associated with trainings and certifications, and opportunities for career development through our internal Mentoring Program.

Equal Opportunity: Kleinfelder is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans. (Compliant with the new VEVRAA and Section 503 rules)

NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES
Please note that Kleinfelder does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, Kleinfelder will not consider or agree to payment for any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, Kleinfelder explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resume, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Kleinfelder.

Title: Civil Design Engineer
Job Description:
Salary: $60k - 75k per year + Benefits
Reference: CDE01
Civil Design Engineer (Entry Level) – $60,000 - $75,000 + Benefits – East Rochester, NY
The Role
Are you a recent engineering grad looking to kick-start your career in the civil engineering world? Do you have a passion for designing civil engineering projects? If so, we’d have the perfect role for you!
We are looking for an energetic, creative and hard-working Civil Design Engineer to join our team! You will be responsible for performing preliminary pile designs, take-offs, and quotations. You will review and understand project plans, specifications, and geotechnical reports and coordinate project pile/foundation designs.
Key Responsibilities
The key responsibilities of a Civil Design Engineer include, but are not limited to:
Perform preliminary pile designs, take-offs, and quotations:
Review and understand the project plans, specifications, and geotechnical reports.
Coordinate project pile/foundation designs.
Provide design and/or material recommendations including Value Engineering (VE) pile design alternates.
Collaborate with the Team to understand client and project needs to offer the most economical design.
Coordinate and participate in conference calls between the project teams.
Prepare the preliminary design and coordinate material estimates with the team for package distribution to the customer.
Manage execution of signed & sealed design submittals:
Verify all project information (plans, specifications, and geotechnical reports) is available and adequate for the design process.
Coordinate submittal completion with the engineering firm within the project schedule.
Review and coordinate any revisions that may be requested.
Address design RFIs.
Provide supporting documentation as required.
Create and provide CAD drawings.
The Company
IDEAL Foundation Systems manufactures and distributes deep foundation systems. As the leader in the deep foundation industry, we understand the value of a happy, enthused workforce and we believe it is what put us where we are today. We listen to staff opinions, encourage training and personal development, and make sure efforts are rewarded.
The Benefits
Paid Time Off & Employee Perks Bonuses.
The Person
The key skills and qualities of a Civil Design Engineer are:
An Associates’ Level Engineering Degree or Construction Technology Degree.
Geotechnical and structural engineering experience or courses required.
Ability to work (independently and in a team setting) under pressure with challenging deadlines.
Advanced computer program skills specifically with various CAD programs (including Inventor), Salesforce.com, Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SmartSheet.
Previous experience in the deep foundation/construction industry a plus.
IDEAL is offering a great opportunity to join a team of innovators and develop a career with competitive benefits and professional development. Apply today and start your IDEAL journey!

Title: Structural Engineer
Job Description:
WHO IS JLM STRATEGIC TALENT PARTNERS & WHAT IS OUR ROLE
We partner with National & International prime contractors to provide them with qualified talent they can trust.
We accomplish this by sourcing & vetting high level career seeking candidates in the industry and match them with our partners current open roles. Our objective is to help our general contractor partners build out project teams for high level infrastructure projects across the US.
We aspire to partner with candidates who are eager to learn, grow, and progress in their career path while deepening their knowledge in their given field.
We deeply value our partnerships and place great emphasis on maintaining strong relationships and long term hires.This is reflective in our competitive offerings to our hires including:
Ongoing HR support
Competitive benefits packages including- Health, Dental, Vision & Life insurance
Our very own JLM Rewards incentive program
THE IDEAL CANDIDATE
The ideal candidate has a proven track record of building, tracking and ordering materials for structural construction work (not necessary but highly preferred).
They thrive in a fast paced and a team oriented environment.
They get excited about construction projects as well as completing assignments on time.
An individual who will do well in this position is self oriented, organized, a great communicator, and approachable.
Comfortable working within a team environment at the project site in Black Canyon City, AZ.
Experience in self-perform batching of concrete is a plus but not necessary.
Working with a superintendent to help schedule work shifts, materials ordering, and subcontractor management.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES/SKILLS
Performs routine duties requiring knowledge of structural engineering principles.
Limited exercise of judgment is required on details of work.
Performs specific and limited portions of broader assignments.
Being able to communicate with subs and vendors and being able to identify and help solve any discrepancies.
Knowledge of Submittal/RFI/Change process/Purchase Orders.
Willing to work collaboratively and respectfully within a team environment.
Structures on the job consist of partial bridge demo and rebuild and CMU/Sound Walls.
Heavy rebar and concrete ordering and tracking.

PERKS OF JOINING JLM

We offer a competitive compensation package as well as benefits including Health Insurance, Vision, Dental, Life, and Paid Time Off!

Title: Lead Structural Engineer
Job Description:
LSE Structural Engineer Leader
Job description
Licensed Structural Engineers, Inc…With the collective experience of a nationwide community of local licensed engineers, Licensed Structural Engineers, Inc. (LSE) sets the standard for high-quality structural engineering services. From California to Florida and from Texas to New York, LSE forms a coalition of local engineers with broad experiences in residential and commercial projects. At LSE, we know that reliable expertise doesn’t have to come with a hefty price tag. In addition to affordability, we are proven to deliver quickly by using the redundancy of our business model. Life is busy, and we know our clients want engineering work done in a timely manner. With our collective knowledge, Licensed Structural Engineers, Inc. ensures to deliver quality work in reliable, affordable, and timely services.
At LSE, we are expanding our Engineering Team and looking to hire either Full time Structural Engineer Leader. This position will report directly to the Project Manager of your region. The structural engineer is a type of civil engineer who handles a number of responsibilities ranging from creating drawings and blueprints to overseeing construction sites. The primary task is to design buildings and other structures to withstand the elements and usage demands.
Structural Engineer Qualifications
Professional Engineer License preferred
Master's degree in Structural Engineering or Civil Engineer preferred
Experience developing schematics for structures in accordance with client specifications and safety standards
Project development and leadership skills are essential
Self directs work with limited supervision
Professional work experience in developing blueprints and designs for proposed structures
Provide guidance, leadership and training to less experienced engineers
Lead small team to complete task/design on project
Experience with software engineering, customer experience and design architecture
Advanced understanding of build materials, techniques and processes
Up to date understanding of best practices regarding building safety measures
Proposal Management a PLUS
Responsibilities
Performs complex calculations and applies standards correctly without supervision
Reviews the work of other engineers designers developing engineering and design documents as needed for the project
Analyzing data: Utilize data that is gathered to determine the best way to structure and design their proposed project.
Budgets/Sales: Possibly assist with sales calls to ensure that correct estimates are generated from the systems dashboard. Possibly generating more revenue for future clients.
Designs: Using specific materials and tools, structural engineer will create in-depth designs and blueprints for the project.
Monitoring projects: Structural engineer will oversee the projects process and ensure compliance including the project be completed accurately and on time.
Mentor Civil Engineers and facilitate a holistic understanding as to the scope and plan for projects
Work closely with building department within the company to ensure hardware is available for projects and working properly
Define clear goals for all aspects of a project and develop steps for their proper execution
Provide detailed specifications for proposed solutions including time and scope involved
Account for possible project challenges or constraints and proactively seek to manage challenges
Assist other department engineers in creating practical demonstrations of proposed solutions and demonstrating them to other members of the team
Work alongside project management teams to successfully monitor progress and implementation of initiatives
Establish a framework for necessary contributions from various departments and facilitate their collaboration
Requirements and skills
Leadership Skills
Knowledge of engineering science and technology.
Math knowledge.
Knowledge of building and construction.
Design skills and knowledge.
Excellent verbal communication skills.
Complex problem-solving skills.
Thinking and reasoning skills.
To be thorough and pay attention to detail.
Other Benefits
If offered Full Time there is a generous Benefits package included. Pay is between $75,000-$125,000 per year; plus bonuses

Title: Structural Engineer - Entry Level Design Engineer
Job Description:
Office Location Los Angeles, CA
Post Date 2022-12-21
Team Los Angeles, CA

Position Summary
KPFF Los Angeles Structural is looking for full-time structural engineering professionals who are self-motivated and eager to deepen their knowledge of structural engineering while gaining real-world experience.
Our engineers work in a team structure that allows frequent collaboration and connection to all layers of our organization, from interns to Principals. We foster a culture where our engineers collaborate outside of the project work through social events, educational programs and technical training. We provide numerous opportunities for professional growth, learning, and teaching. Individual accomplishments and successful projects determine your future at KPFF, and your dedication and talent will drive your career here.
This is an Exempt employment position, all overtime hours are paid at an hourly rate.
Benefits
KPFF is proud to provide our employees with benefits options that fit their unique lives, including:
Two medical insurance plan options for you to choose from, a traditional PPO plan and a HDHP plan
Dental Insurance
7 paid holidays, and 2 floating holidays for you to use each year
2 weeks vacation annually, with competitive seniority based accruals
2 weeks of personal and sick time to care for yourself and your family members
KPFF will contribute 3% of your base salary to your 401 (k) regardless of your contribution
KPFF Paid Family Leave: Provides 60% of your base salary while on an approved leave for up to 6 weeks in a rolling 12-month period
40-hour work schedule, Monday through Friday
Flexible scheduling - core hours of collaboration are 9:30-3:30 PM
Company cell phone or monthly stipend for licensed PE's and SE's
Monthly Way We Work stipend for remote work and transit expenses
Semi-annual Bonuses
Opportunities for educational events, relationship building, and fun!
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Basic knowledge of engineering fundamentals
Excellent interpersonal communication and professional demeanor
Effectively work on a team with individuals of varying backgrounds and experiences
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Solid technical skills
Ability to independently plan, document, organize, and engage in problem solving
Excellent research and information gathering skills
Minimum Qualifications
BS in Civil Engineering (with an emphasis in Structures)
Transcripts must show completed courses in:
Concrete
Steel or Wood Design
No full-time work experience is required
Preferred Qualifications
3.0 Cumulative GPA or above in Bachelor’s coursework
Master’s degree in Civil Engineering with an emphasis in Structures
Candidates with transcripts showing completed graduate coursework in:
Structural Design
Steel or Wood Design
Concrete
Seismic
Previous intern or full-time experience in a Structural or Civil Engineering role
EIT Certification
Application Process
If you are interested in this position, please apply on our careers page. Resumes sent elsewhere will not be considered.
Link to job posting:https://www.kpff.com/job-details/1750/
To complete your applicaiton, submit unlocked PDFs of your most current transcripts for all undergraduate & graduate coursework along with a cover letter.
In your cover letter (PDF) please respond to the following prompts:
Describe a time when you were assigned a project or task that turned out to be really difficult. How did you work through it, and what was the outcome?
Who has most influenced you and why?
Physical Demands and Work Environment
Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table.
Duties require the ability to actively engage with a computer for several hours per day.
May occasionally need to lift items up to 15 lbs.
Our Employees
Are valued and empowered, collaborative and team oriented, innovative in their approach and passionate about their work. They are reliable, trustworthy and open with a high level of integrity. They value diversity, are inclusive and are committed to critically thinking through problems and finding solutions.
Our Company
KPFF Consulting Engineers provides civil and structural engineering services to architects, government agencies, developers, contractors, and institutional clients. Our Los Angeles Structural office is located at the Bloc in Downtown Los Angeles. A warm and friendly environment, we are dedicated to growing with our employees and allowing people to pursue their passions. KPFF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.

Title: Structural Engineer
Job Description:
Hello. We are GEI.
Some of the world s most pressing problems – from climate change to sustainable development, to critical infrastructure and the future of our energy supply – need our brightest and diverse minds working together to create safer, more resilient communities for tomorrow.
We are technical experts, collaborators, and entrepreneurs who draw from diverse backgrounds to solve our clients most complex challenges.
With more than 40 offices across North America, we offer a range of engineering, science, and technical consulting services. Our range of expertise, project types, and culture make us the choice for top talent in the AEC industry.
Employee-owned. Employee-focused.
As a 100% employee-owned company, our employees support our flat leadership structure, have a say in how our business operates and benefit from our financial success. We are committed to employee growth with career development opportunities, competitive total rewards, a well-being program, flexible work arrangements and more. Our company culture is driven by our 4 Cs – we are Client-Centered, Curious, Collaborative, and Community Minded – which support our focus on sustainability, safety, diversity, equity and inclusion. Get to know us better by visiting GEI s career site here.
Your role at GEI.
Job Description
GEI s New York City offices are seeking a motivated & experienced structural engineer to assist on a variety of projects throughout the region. Work will primarily pertain to residential and commercial properties including building envelope design, failure investigation, NYC FISP (Local Law 11) inspection and reports, and other exciting work.
Essential Responsibilities & Duties
Assisting project managers to execute projects and assignments associated with structural engineering.
Structural analysis and design of existing residential and commercial buildings as related to existing building envelope assemblies such as framing, windows, doors, parapets, and roofs.
Collaborate with project managers and technical staff across the company.
Document as-built conditions and review repair work on both supported scaffold and suspended scaffold.
Write letters and prepare technical reports.
Travel to project sites and other offices as required, including overnight travel.
Assist with the preparation of proposals, and the development of project plans, schedules, and budgets.
Develop construction drawings, technical specifications, cost estimates, and bid documents.
Provide construction administration and field observation.
Communicate with clients, contractors, and third-party vendors.
Minimum Qualifications
B.S. in Civil Engineering; Master s in Structural Engineering preferred.
Structural course work required.
0 to 5 years of experience in facade rehabilitation, roofing, waterproofing, windows and structural investigations.
Familiarity with NYC Building Code.
Must have passed the F.E. exam.
SPRAT certification a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Working knowledge of CAD and other common software used in the engineering profession. Experience in Civil 3D a plus.
Travel to job locations as needed.
Must have a valid U.S. driver's license.
Ability to perform field work on active construction sites without restrictions, and in inclement weather if required.
Benefits
Market-Competitive Compensation
Annual Salary $70,000-$95,000 depending on experience
Comprehensive Benefits Program, including Medical, Dental, Vision and More
Continuing Education Assistance and Tuition Reimbursement
Professional Development and Opportunities for Advancement
Paid Holidays and Paid Time Off
Rewards and Recognition
GEI-Funded Profit Sharing and 401(k)
And More…

Florida’s largest building inspection company is expanding its current services offering of building safety re-certification to deliver various State and County Mandated Building Certifications. Its Leadership requires the expertise and approval authority of a Professional Engineer (PE). We live our Vision of People CARING for People & Empowering them to make life changing decisions. As an Allied team member, you’ll enjoy:
Healthcare and Simple IRA benefits

Title: Sr. Structural Engineer - Aerospace
Job Description:
RapidFlight is reshaping UAS design and manufacturing to answer industry demands with speed and agility. Our team fuses leading-edge technologies and manufacturing processes to deploy high-performance systems at scale. With a laser-focus on mission-driven requirements, we provide our clients with end-to-end support from design and fabrication to systems integrations and operational logistics.
This position is located in Manassas, VA. Candidate must be in a commutable distance or willing to relocate.
Responsibilities:
The Senior Structural Engineer guides the success of RapidFlight’s engineering and development efforts with design, analysis, and execution at the integrated system and subsystems level to meet a wide variety of mission requirements. This role contributes to systems creation and maturation through applied research, prototyping, and operationally relevant testing while collaborating with a multi-disciplinary team of professionals to create innovative airborne technology solutions. Specific contributions in this role include airframe structural design, analysis, and test from initial concept to final build, airframe structural optimization, subsystem integration, payload support systems development, laboratory/field testing, and documentation.
This role also participates in our research and development efforts exploring new technology solutions and methods to expand the envelope of aerospace technology. Expect periodic travel to support suppliers, customers, field testing, and demos. This role reports to the Director of Engineering with matrixed reporting to integrated program teams (IPTs). Expect daily interaction with other disciplines focused on developing aircraft. Qualified Senior-level applicants are expected to have demonstrated competency to perform in the following skill areas:
Spearhead airframe structural design in response to specific design criteria and program requirements.
Payload integration, design and fabrication of custom interfaces.
Validation of designs against requirements and environmental constraints using first principles structural analysis methods, Finite Element Analysis, proof of concept prototyping, and design of experiment (DOE) methodologies.
Perform aerostructures modal analysis.
Contribute to flutter analyses.
Plan and conduct material test plans to establish material allowables and inform structural design criteria.
Plan and conduct structural testing of major aircraft components and subcomponents.
Cultivate a thorough understanding of the UAS and aerial robotics industry best practices in component design, fabrication of various materials, advanced manufacturing, and design for manufacturability.
Advance engineering organizational understanding of additive manufacturing design as applied in airborne applications; including but not limited to design techniques, fabrication, bonding, fastening, and finishing techniques.
Contribute to engineering Bill-Of-Material (BOM) with iterative mass, material, cost, and production detail.
Identify, mitigate, and track engineering risk and communicate those risks with a broader integrated product team (IPT).
Contribute to internal research and development (IR&D) creative processes.
Support in-house integration and testing of subsystems and assemblies.
Support field testing in a variety of environments.
Record design attributes, analysis results, and test results in support of design reviews and airworthiness certification.
Need to have:
Bachelor’s degree in Aerospace/Aeronautical engineering or similar technical degree.
Ten (10)+ years of experience in UAV and aeronautical engineering.
Finite Element Analysis experience (Ansys preferred).
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent managerial and supervisory skills.
Nice to Have:
Master’s degree in Aerospace/Aeronautical engineering or similar technical degree.
Please expect to sign a non-disclosure agreement (NDA) prior to an on-site interview.
Sponsorship is not offered for this position. Upon hire, chosen candidate must present valid document(s) that confirm identification and eligibility to work in the United States.
RapidFlight requires its employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19 or to request reasonable accommodation for medical or religious exemption.
RapidFlight is an equal opportunities employer and VEVRAA Federal Contractor. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.
