Title: Field Engineer – Structural (Florida/Louisiana/Mississippi/Southern AL)
Job Description:
Description
REWARDS AT SIMPSON STRONG-TIE
We recognize and reward employees with a carefully designed and comprehensive rewards package, including competitive compensation, quarterly bonuses or commission and first-rate benefits. May exclude some positions, such as seasonal jobs.
Quarterly Bonuses/Commission: You will be eligible for either a bonus or commission, paid on a quarterly basis. We believe all employees affect customers, sales and revenue — directly or indirectly – and should be rewarded by sharing the company profits.
Benefits: We provide a wide range of benefits for eligible full-time employees including: medical, dental, vision, retirement contributions, employee stock purchase and bonus plans, pay for holidays, vacation, sick days, funerals and jury duty, years of service awards, employee discounts, employee referral bonuses, charitable contribution matching, education reimbursement and more.
HOW WE'RE MAINTAINING A SAFE WORK ENVIRONMENT
These are some of the ways we're maintaining a safe work environment at Simpson Strong-Tie.
Sanitizing: Increased cleaning and disinfecting of facilities
Hand Sanitizer and Wipes: Providing hand sanitizer and wipes throughout our facilities
Face Coverings: Providing face coverings for employees
BE A MAKER
At Simpson Strong-Tie, there’s a common thread connecting the people who work here: the drive to make things better and figure out how to get it done. We call it the Maker mindset. For over 60 years, our employees have fostered a collaborative workplace where people are engaged in creative thinking from the first day on the job onward. No matter what role you’re in — from production, to sales, to engineering — you’ll contribute to the growth and success of the company by having a Maker mindset.

When you think of the best a family has to offer — support, collaboration and respect — that's what we value. When there's a win, we'll cheer you on. When there's a snag, coworkers step in to help you out. Working on solutions together is just the way we do things here, and that creates an atmosphere that often feels like home.

You'll work alongside talented, passionate, dedicated, humble and genuinely kind people who are all contributing to our shared mission: to provide solutions that help people design and build safer, stronger structures. It's this mission and our strong people-focused values that have made Simpson Strong-Tie a unique place to work — a place where you can connect, create and build your career. We invite you to learn more about our culture and why our employees are our most loyal customers.
YOU
You want to be an important member of a strong team of other makers who take pride in their work and support each other. As a Field Engineer, you will be responsible for delivering education, services and support to customers in innovative ways across our product lines. You will establish and maintain relationships with design professionals, specifiers and major contractors to provide technical support and obtain the specification of Simpson Strong-Tie product lines, with emphasis on Anchoring Systems, Connectors for Cold-Formed Steel Construction, Repair-Protection-Strengthening Systems lines and Structural Steel product lines. You will be a top-level contributor/specialist who will provide consultation on complex projects while performing a variety of tasks. You will work closely with sales team to identify and support closing of sales opportunities. This position is located in a major metro city in the state of Florida and service the states of FL, LA, MS and Southern AL.
WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING (% of Time)
Provide technical support for our concrete anchoring, strengthening, and repair products to our customers and our staff. You will use your experience, product knowledge and training to develop solutions for a wide variety of applications. Establish and maintain relationships with design professionals, specifiers, and major contractors to obtain the specification of Simpson products. (60%)
Conduct technical presentations for individuals, groups and professional associations involved in new construction and/or the repair and rehabilitation of existing structures, focusing on both general technical knowledge as well as the advantages and use of Simpson products. (30%)
Work closely with our engineering and sales teams to identify opportunities and supply product solutions (10%)
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
If you can do everything listed above, you’ve got what it takes. Perhaps some of the following would be helpful too:
Bachelor's Degree (B.S.) in civil or structural engineering required.
Engineering-In-Training (EIT) required.
Licensed Professional Engineer, Civil or Structural (PE or SE) preferred.
4 years structural engineering experience designing commercial structures; reinforced concrete, masonry, cold-formed steel, and structural steel.
Construction: Practical working knowledge of common concrete and steel construction methods.
Product knowledge: General knowledge of concrete anchors and light gage steel. Design experience with fasteners, connectors, and lateral systems a plus.
2 years computer experience (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, ACAD, various design software).
Knowledge: Practical working knowledge of common concrete and steel construction methods. Familiarity with Simpson products is a plus.
Customer focus: Quickly and effectively solve customer problems and maintain productive internal and external customer relationships. Readily readjust priorities to respond to pressing and changing customer needs. Recognize potentially adverse customer reactions and develop better alternatives.
Self-management: Set priorities, goals and timelines to achieve maximum productivity. Manage multiple projects and competing priorities. Display a high level of initiative, effort, and commitment towards completing assignments in a timely manner.
Communication: Excellent communication skills; written and verbal, proof reading, professional phone demeanor. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. Enthusiastic attitude and ability to work well with others.
Teamwork: Maintain a collaborative approach in dealing with other Simpson Strong-Tie employees.
Demonstrate a genuine commitment to reach mutually beneficial solutions.
Driving record: Possess and maintain a driving record which complies with company policy.
TRAVEL REQUIRED
This job requires 30-50% domestic travel with occasional overnight stays.
WORK STATUS & LOCATION
This full-time, exempt position is located in a major metro city in the state of Florida and service the states of FL, LA, MS and Southern AL.
RELOCATION
Relocation may be considered for this position.
Pay
$69400 - $90200 / year
In keeping with the Company's commitment to the communities in which it does business, we are an equal opportunity employer. This means that to the fullest extent required by local law, employment decisions are based on merit and business needs and not on race, color, citizenship status, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender (which state law may define to include gender identity/expression, transgender identity, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical condition, and gender stereotyping), sexual orientation, age, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, genetic information, medical condition, covered marital status, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law.
Please note all job offers are contingent upon a successful background investigation and drug test. Simpson Strong-Tie’s drug policy is based upon Federal Law, and therefore will screen applicants for amphetamines, including methamphetamines, cocaine, marijuana/THC, phencyclidine, and opiates.

Title: Structural Engineer
Job Description:
Chief Agri is seeking a Structural Engineer to join the Chief team. This position will develop custom designs, new products, and analyze process for structural product lines, collaborate with a Structural Analyst to optimize design of connections and members, and collaborate with an international team of structural engineers. Primary job tasks for this role may be completed at a location remote from the company's primary office.
Job Responsibilities:
Uses proven structural engineering techniques to complete projects. Develops new design and process techniques. Must produce consistent, accurate, and timely results with minimal guidance.
Is able to interpret and implement codes (USA codes: IBC, AISC, AISI, or Eurocode)
Plans and manages physical tests, optimizes design based on results.
Creates computer analysist models (RISA or SCIA), is able to work collaboratively with FEA analyst, and reviews designs/calculations performed by others.
Answers questions from sales personnel and customers. May visit customer’s sites to evaluate applications and issues. Limited travel required, domestic and international (<10%)
Qualifications and Skill Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Structural/Civil Engineering Required. Master’s Degree preferred.
Experience with engineering analysis software such as Risa or Scia or other structural engineering analysis software highly desired.
Experience with 3D parametric design software (Solidworks is currently used) required.
4+ years of Engineering experience preferred.
Professional Engineer license preferred.
The Company:
Putting the needs of customers first has taken Chief Industries, Inc. from a small construction company in 1954, to a highly diverse company with a reputation for manufacturing quality products and offering unparalleled customer service. Through its many divisions and subsidiaries, Chief Industries employs over 1,400 skilled and dedicated employees who produce a wide variety of products, many of which are used around the world.
A division of Chief Industries, Chief Agri originated in 1961 and offers a full line of aeration and material handling products to help grain producers minimize storage costs and maximize the selling price of their commodities. Manufactured to exacting standards using heavy-duty materials and innovative designs, Chief grain conditioning, handling, and storage systems are sold throughout the world and have a reputation for providing many long years of dependable service.

Paid vacation and PTO policies
Paid holidays
Medical, dental, vision, and life Insurance
Wellness program
401(k) retirement with company match
Disability insurance

And much more.

Title: Junior Civil Engineer - Storage & Structures
Job Description:
Position Title: Junior Civil Engineer - Storage & Structures
Department: Global Product Management
Division: AGI Corporate
Location: Naperville, IL, USA
About AGI
AGI is a global food-based infrastructure company publicly traded in Canada. With over 4,200 employees and over 30 global manufacturing brands, AGI is a leading provider of equipment and technology solutions for agricultural commodities including seed, fertilizer, grain and feed systems and an expanding platform for food processing facilities.
The Opportunity
The Junior Civil Engineer – Storage & Structures will provide support in the application of principles and codes of structural engineering in designing, planning and overseeing fabrication of steel structures designated to the storage of different materials (grains, fertilizer, liquids) for the North American market.
The Team
This role will report to the Product Engineer – Global storage and structural products, and work in close coordination with the wider Global product management & engineering teams on various projects.
Responsibilities
Provide support in the design of storage & steel structures according industry theories and applicable standards.
Understand, assess, and simplify engineering problems to threat the everyday business needs in a cost-effective manner.
Carry out FE analysis when required.
Review/draft detailed dimensional drawings and design layouts for products & project and to ensure conformance to specifications.
Calculate dimensions, square footage, profile and component specifications, and material quantities using calculator or computer.
Read and review project blueprints and structural specifications to determine dimensions of structure or system and material requirements.
Prepare reports and document project activities and data.
Conduct materials test and analysis on prototypes using tools and equipment and applying engineering knowledge.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering.
Relevant course work on FE & structural engineering and/or related college projects.
Experience with software for FE analysis (RISA 3D, STAAD Pro, RISA Section, CFS) will be an asset
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, and Microsoft Outlook
Proficiency in Inventor, AutoCAD, and Vault preferred
Understanding and application of steel and building codes AISC and ASCE is essential.
Excellent verbal and written communication
Ability to work as part of a team

Title: Structural Engineer
Job Description:
COMPANY MISSION STATEMENT: We will build value for our customers while providing custom packaging through careful analysis, functional design, quality manufacturing, timely delivery, and courteous service
PRIMARY: To support sales in fulfilling and exceeding customer expectations and design needs in a timely and profitable manner.
AUTHORITIES: The following are granted to the Designer:
To exercise the responsibilities and perform the duties of this position, within the guidelines provided by the company’s Employee Manual and Operations Manual.
RESPONSIBILITIES: The following are upheld by the Designer:
Adhering to the codes of the company’s Employee Manual.
Maintaining a constructive environment at work. This includes self-evaluating work performance, on a fair basis.
Developing and adhering to written Standard Operating Procedures for all aspects of this position.
Adhering to departmental operating guidelines.
Providing insightful and enthusiastic teamwork that generally creates positive attitudes and builds supportive morale.
Maintaining open communications and a harmonious working relationship with all personnel, but in particular with those involved in a reporting relationship. This includes attending weekly departmental meetings, as well as helping resolve interdepartmental conflicts.
Participating in seminars to train all departmental personnel when needed. This includes learning product knowledge and procedural proficiencies.
Conducting all operations within established budgets.
Using and submitting all forms and reports in a complete, accurate, and timely basis. This includes respecting and maintaining proper filing systems.
Ensuring your work areas are clean and presentable to customers and other visitors.
Maintaining a reasonable work environment and providing adequate safeguards for your work-related health and safety. This includes complying with all Federal, state, and local laws and regulations.
Maintaining all external relationships consistent with the objectives, operating philosophy, and desired image of the company, re: customer relations, public relations, vendor relations, and community relations.
Maintaining confidentiality on all corporate subjects so classified.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES: The following are performed by the Designer:
Sales Support
Coordinate with sales and the customer in order to determine customer needs and expectations
Coordinate with Production in order to ensure that what we design creates the most effective and cost efficient package
Prioritize workload and stay on schedule
Notify sales if work cannot be completed on time
Revise and improve designs based on changing customer needs, production requirements, or simply a more efficient methodology
Review and process Orders for New Items and Change Orders, make recommendations
Create Masters in the computer according to the specifications needed
Save Masters in the proper file format
Print Masters
Stamp “Original” on Specification sheet
Fill out “Pink Slip” for change orders
Create “Yellow” Master File Jackets (Update for change orders)
Enter specifications in SD200 based on quote for production
Forward order and change orders to Customer Service
Minimize personal time on the phone to free up phone lines for customer service
Graphics Design
Coordinate ink types and specifications with Plant Manager, provide suggestions where appropriate
Assist Plant Manager with quality control problems concerning graphics and labeling, especially on IRT (Production assumes responsibility for efficiency & quality; Graphics Designer provides consultation, recommendations and input to further efficiency & quality.)
If Production is having quality control problems and is unable or unwilling to correct them, forward recommendations to Quality Control for resolution
Approve and supervise new orders (First Run Only ) in production which contain graphic
Structural Design
Design new displays and packaging
Process sample requests and fabricate on the sample table
Assign sample number, maintain sample log
Revise sample
Forward samples and design specifications to sales
File specifications
Maintain the sample table (Clean and Vacuum table top, front control panel, lubricate, etc.)
Perform ISTA testing of packages, ensure that they are according to specifications
Foam Design
Determine needs and create design for packaging
Create a preliminary sample
Create CAD drawing for quotation
Create Die Layout for quote
Obtain a quote on foam
Forward information to sales
Upon approval of order, place PO for foam
When items arrive, coordinate receiver with shipping
Open and inspect material, ensure that material is according to specifications
Approve Shipper (Sign and Date)
Forward Master to shipping and Customer Service
General Maintenance
Maintain design software, update as required
Perform backups on a regular basis
Maintain general cleanliness of immediate work area
Clean the general area of the design room as assigned (Sweep floor, coke machine, etc.)
PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS: The following are required of the Designer:
To meet or beat all budgets, time schedules, and performance evaluation goals at least 95% of the time, without sacrificing quality or safety.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: The following are expected of the Designer:
EXPERIENCE: Minimum three years of hands-on experience in these or related functions.
EDUCATION: Minimum two years of college or vocational training in this field, or exceptional direct experience.
EEO/OSHA/ADA: Able to manipulate and use CRT/screens, keyboards, mouse/pointing devices, etc., associated with contemporary computers. Able to sit or stand for extended periods of time. Able to navigate two flights of stairs without harm. Able to lift up to 50 pounds unaided.

Title: Structural Engineer, EIT
Location: 8911 N Capital Of Texas Hwy, Austin, TX 78759
Job Description:
Discover your full potential. At Tetra Tech, we are collaborating with industry-leading experts for a sustainable future for our world. We combine consulting and engineering with advanced analytics and technology to solve the world’s most complex challenges. Our innovation hubs across the globe will enable you to share ideas and best practices while growing your professional network. Wherever you are in your career journey, you will benefit from working with world-class engineers, scientists, and technical specialists.
Apply today and join the company that is Leading with Science®.
Summary
Tetra Tech is currently seeking a full-time Structural Engineer with 6+ years of experience to lead challenging projects of various construction types in a wide range of industry sectors. Projects will vary in the locality from local and regional work to overseas, providing unique engineering experiences. Project types will include municipal, industrial, commercial, government, forensic, renovation work on historic structures, and civil works (spillways, floodwalls, and gate structures) projects for the US Army Corps of Engineers. The successful candidate will work with other Tetra Tech team members in the delivery of company project initiatives related to structural engineering. The ideal candidate enjoys working as a team player in a flexible environment and seeing the work followed through during onsite visits.
Your Role
Structural engineering design for a multitude of projects under the guidance of a Senior Engineer.
Delivering quality work on time and within budget.
Working with a team of Structural Engineers and Designers for larger projects.
Writing structural investigation and design reports.
Defining the structural system by modeling in Revit.
Designing to local and State Codes, as well as Federal Unified Facilities Criteria (UFC) guidelines.
Utilizing advanced structural engineering software tools.
Preparing calculation packages.
Participating in Construction Administration activities when required by the project.
Qualifications
Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering (Masters preferred)
EIT or in the process of becoming a licensed P.E (S.E. preferred)
One plus years of related experience as a Structural Engineer. We will consider entry-level candidates; however experienced candidates are preferred.
Knowledgeable in the design of structural steel, reinforced concrete, masonry, aluminum, and wood.
Experience with designing structures located in geographical areas prone to hurricanes and high seismicity is a plus.
Must be willing to learn and use Revit, if not already known, for 3D BIM production.
Proficient with structural engineering analysis and design software such as RISA 3D.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential.
Well organized and able to work independently on assignments.
Capable of working in a fast-paced environment on projects ranging from studies to detailed design.
About Tetra Tech
Tetra Tech combines the resources of a global, multibillion-dollar company with local, client-focused delivery in more than 400+ locations around the world. Our reputation rests on our employees' technical expertise and dedication—21,000+ associates working together to provide smart, scalable solutions for challenging projects. We are proud to be home to leading technical experts in water, environment, infrastructure, resource management, energy, and international development.
Explore our open positions at https://www.tetratech.com/careers. Follow us on social media to learn more about our people, culture, and opportunities:

Tetra Tech is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity, inclusion, and equity are among Tetra Tech’s core values. Title: Distribution Engineer - remote
Job Description:
Overview / Responsibilities:
Wood currently has exciting opportunities for a Distribution Engineer. Reporting to the Manager, Distribution Engineering.

This position is a remote position or is a hybrid position in any of the following offices - Orlando, FL, Tampa, FL, Tallahassee, FL or West Palm Beach, FL

If you have a successful track record and thrive on challenges in a fast-paced environment, this is the opportunity for you.

Key Responsibilities

Engineering of distribution electrical projects through the entire project lifecycle: from conceptual and feasibility, though detailed design, to construction and service
Leading or supporting overhead and underground distribution engineering projects defining scopes of work, completing cost estimates, performing engineering calculations, interconnection studies and developing detailed design drawings
Supporting the preparation of technical specifications, tender documents, technical reports, and project calculations.
Providing construction support and overall project engineering coordination (as required)
Responding to information requests during construction and completing project documentation including preparation of record drawings
Leading a team of engineers and designers when required to successfully deliver a portfolio of projects
Maintaining and enhancing relationships with other design disciplines and external stakeholders and assist team leads and managers
Traveling and visiting project sites during design and construction (as required)
Skills / Qualifications:
Electrical Engineering Degree from a recognized university along with a Professional Engineering Designation or eligibility for registration
3 years of overhead and underground distribution engineering experience serving utilities in North America
Knowledge of CSA/IEC/NESC/IEEE Standards and Codes and major utility Engineering Standards
Knowledge of electrical design including the selection and installation of conductors, insulators, switchgears, circuit breakers, fuses and other distribution equipment
Knowledge of smart infrastructure equipment such as automatic feeder switches, remote sensing switching, remote sensing cap banks and other smart equipment
Knowledge of PV’s and EV’s
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Able to collaborate and communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders
Able to exercise initiative when resolving issues and in adapting and applying procedures to address unusual situations
Able to take on responsibility for your outputs on high-profile projects and grow professionally with our expanding organization
Clean driving record/abstract
The following qualifications are considered an asset:

Knowledge of structural, civil and geotechnical aspects of distribution engineering
Knowledge of overhead systems design and the use of PLS-CADD
Knowledge of interconnecting DER’s and modeling interconnection studies
Experience in power system analysis (such as voltage drop, equipment loading, steady-state voltage rise, etc.) using software such as CYME, ETAP, EasyPower, SKM.
Experience with substation and transmission projects
Experience with AutoCAD
Experience with GIS applications (Smallworld, GE, Bently)
Experience with Structural Analysis Software (SpidaCalc, Pole Foreman, PLS-CADD)
Experience mentoring junior staff
Experience in both Canada and United States working for a local Utility company
Experience working in a utility or consulting environment and managing multiple projects with competing priorities
Company Overview:
Wood is a global leader in consulting and engineering, helping to unlock solutions to critical challenges in energy and materials markets. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in 60 countries, employing around 35,000 people. www.woodplc.com
Diversity Statement:
We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

Title: Structural Designer - Remote
Job Description:
WHY CHA?
Responsibility connects us, empowers us, binds us to our community, and challenges us to do what is right. Clean water, safe roads, efficient energy, resilient power sources, and buildings that enhance their surroundings – these are significant responsibilities we take to heart.

At CHA, we believe in responsibly improving the world we live in, and we ask our team to aspire to that ideal every day. At the foundation of our responsibility is our commitment to inclusion and diversity and choosing to treat everyone with dignity and equality. We also take accountability for making decisions that promote sustainability in our business and our designs. We are on a mission to reduce our environmental footprint and bring greener solutions to our clients. We believe it is our responsibility and work to do that each day.

CHA Consulting, Inc. is currently seeking a Structural Designer - Remote to join our Advanced Energy team. This individual has the option of working from home or from any of the following office locations: Colonie, NY; Syracuse, NY; or Parsippany, NJ.

CHA believes our employees should have the time and flexibility to balance work and personal commitments. We offer most employees the option of a hybrid schedule with a work week that includes both office and work from home days.
YOUR IMPACT
CHA has consistently ranked as one of Engineering News Record’s Top 20 US firms serving the manufacturing sector. We are nationally known for our expertise in the identification and delivery of energy efficiency and generation solutions for the commercial, institutional, and industrial sectors.

At CHA, our Structural Designer - Remote is responsible for the research, preparation, and creation of various types of contract or construction drawings and/or documents. This individual is responsible for collaborating with design teams on multiple projects in a timely and cost-effective manner to meet client, contractual and company requirements.

The Structural Designer - Remote produces and revises routine drawings or sketches related to the engineering design with minimal oversight from senior staff, and is familiar with company standards, client expectations and typical engineering practices. This role is also expected to prepare project “As-Builts” documentation, and field assignments when appropriate.

The Structural Designer - Remote uses drawing production software (REVIT, AutoCAD, MicroStation etc.) to create construction documents.

At CHA, you can build a career and find your passion across our diverse business lines and project teams. Being part of CHA means being part of a team of talented professionals, where you’ll find support for your career growth and the opportunity to impact our industry and our communities. Find your “why” at CHA!
REQUIREMENTS
Associates Degree in Engineering, Engineering Technology, Engineering Science, or related technical field is required
A minimum of 4 years’ experience of document production experience in the related engineering discipline
Experience with steel, concrete, and masonry structures required
Demonstrates a solid working knowledge about the respective engineering discipline
Proficient with discipline-based software (REVIT, AutoCAD, Civil 3D, etc.).
Effective verbal and written communication skills with the ability to adapt communication style to suit various audiences
Strong work ethic and desire to work in a collaborative team environment with the willingness to assist more senior staff
Ability to mentor junior engineering designers
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
Occasional travel to sites
CULTURE/EEO STATEMENT
At CHA, we are helping to build a world where thought leadership, social responsibility, and diversity thrive, and we are committed to recruiting, developing, and retaining a highly talented and diverse team of individuals to help us do it. Our aspiration to responsibly improve the world we live in – combined with hiring practices, training opportunities, and engagement with our communities – reflect a company culture that is progressive and forward leaning.

We as an organization celebrate the values of inclusion and equality, and advocate for the full participation of all people in an environment free of discrimination. To support these values, we invite all qualified applicants to be considered for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
#LI-Hybrid #LI-Remote

Title: Assistant Engineer I (Office) (Open) (Continuous)
Job Description:
The Position
The City of Oakland is an equal opportunity employer that values workforce diversity, inclusion, and equity. Oakland has a long history of activism around issues of justice and equity. Both oppression and this resistance to oppression have shaped the city’s historical roots and the lives of its residents to this day. As public servants to one of the most diverse cities in the nation, we strive to develop employees who understand the harm and impacts of systemic inequity to create lasting, meaningful outcomes for everyone. Oakland strives to establish an environment that embraces the richness of culture, community, and individualism of employees.

The City of Oakland is currently recruiting to fill five (5) Assistant Engineer I (Office) vacancies within the Department of Transportation and the Oakland Public Works Department. The ideal candidate will work in a dynamic environment performing technical and non-technical reviews of building structures for compliance with state laws and local regulations, as well as possess basic knowledge of civil/structural engineering principles; excellent written and verbal communication skills; and works well in both a team and individual setting.

Oakland is experiencing an emerging urban renaissance of great significance. The appeal of living, working, and recreating in Oakland continues to draw new residents and a wider range of employers. Oakland is poised to experience continued growth and a corresponding upward demand for City services. Your work in this position will have an immediate impact on the City operations.

Under immediate supervision in the Oakland Public Works Department (OPW), the Planning and Building Department (PBD) or the Department of Transportation (DOT), an Assistant Engineer I (Office) performs routine civil engineering work; plans and designs street, storm, sewer, traffic systems, and other public works projects; may act as resident engineer on small construction projects; reviews engineering reports, drawings and calculations for buildings structures and public infrastructure while performing plan check; may receive technical direction from Assistant Engineer II; and performs related duties as assigned.

This is an entry level classification in the professional engineering series. Incumbents typically have a bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering and limited related work experience. Assignments are generally limited in scope and are performed within an established procedural framework. Incumbents have working knowledge of various aspects of civil engineering in the planning and design of street, storm, sewer, and traffic systems and building codes. Assistant Engineer Is are responsible for routine office or field projects and are expected to direct them to completion. This classification can be distinguished from Assistant Engineer II in that the latter performs the full range of engineering duties, may act as resident engineer for medium to small sized construction projects, and requires an Engineer-in-Training certificate. An Assistant Engineer I may be assigned to work in the following areas: design, construction, engineering/land use, and plan check.
The incumbent receives immediate supervision from a Civil Engineer, Supervising Civil Engineer, Transportation Engineer, Supervising Transportation Engineer, Senior Transportation Planner or Transportation Planner III.

The eligibility list established from this recruitment may be used to fill other vacancies that occur within the City including full-time and permanent part-time positions, if applicable.

Flexible Staffing: This classification has been designated for flexible staffing. Incumbents in the Assistant Engineer I classification may be eligible to advance without formal examination to the Assistant Engineer II classification in accordance with established City flexible staffing policies and procedures.

This recruitment may close without notice once a sufficient number of applications have been received.
Click on the link below to see a video on what it's like to work for the City of Oakland!
Working for the City of Oakland
Examples of Duties
Duties may include, but are not limited to the following:
Perform routine design duties of a limited nature on a wide variety of public works projects including street, storm, sewer, and traffic systems as well as review of building structures for compliance with state laws and local regulations.
Participate in the preparation and review of plans and specifications; prepare quantity and cost estimates.
Assist resident engineer on large public works construction projects or may act as resident engineer on small construction projects.
Prepare routine technical and non-technical reports and correspondence; prepare daily progress and final reports when assigned to field duties.
Participate in the preparation and review of conditions of approval for private subdivision mapping and other related projects.
Drive a vehicle to work site; may be required to walk uneven surfaces, climb ladders or crawl into closed areas to perform site inspections, take measurements or other field duties; protective wear such as hard hat and boots may be required.
Operate a computer to perform computer aided design and may sit or stand for periods of time depending on assignment.
Minimum Requirements for Application
Any combination of education and experience that is equivalent to the following minimum qualifications may be acceptable.
Education:
A Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering from a college or university accredited by the Accreditation Board of Engineering and Technology
OR
A degree in civil engineering from a non-accredited college and possession of an Engineer-in-Training (EIT) certificate.

Experience :
None required.

License or Certificate / Other Requirements:

Successful incumbents in this position are expected to operate automotive vehicles in the performance of assigned duties. Due to the nature of the assignment and the hours worked, public transportation may not be a cost effective or efficient method for traveling to the various locations required. Individuals who are appointed to this position will be required to maintain a valid California Driver’s License throughout the tenure of employment OR demonstrate the ability to travel to various locations in a timely manner as required in the performance of duties.

FLEXIBLE STAFFING
Incumbents in the Assistant Engineer I classification are eligible to promote to the Assistant Engineer II classification in accordance with established City policy related to flexible staffing.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES

Knowledge of:
Civil engineering principles and practices and their application to municipal public works and design of building structures.
Design principles, strength of materials and stress analysis required in planning public works construction projects and their applications to building structures.
Construction principles including survey, inspection, and engineering methods and materials; surveying methods and techniques.
Principle and practices of designing and drafting, including the use of computer aided design.
Computer systems and software applications.
Ability to:
Prepare accurate plans, specifications, cost estimates and engineering reports; to make accurate engineering computations; analyze and evaluate design drawings and specifications.
Learn and apply established principles and practices of municipal civil engineering and building codes and regulations.
Write clear, concise, and accurate technical and non-technical reports, correspondence, and memoranda.
Communicate effectively and establish and maintain effective working relationships with those contacted in the performance of required duties.
Utilize computer systems and software applications.
Establish and maintain effective working relationships with those contacted in the performance of required duties.
Supplemental Information
The Selection Process
Stage I: The first stage in the selection process will consist of a review of each applicant's employment application, copy of the Engineer-in-Training (EIT) certificate and/or the unofficial college transcripts from an accredited college or university, and supplemental questionnaire for minimum qualifications (weighted pass/fail). Be sure to scan and attach a copy of your Engineer-in-Training (EIT) certificate and/or your unofficial college transcripts from an accredited college or university to your online application. Applications submitted without all required materials will not be given further consideration.
Stage II: The second stage will consist of subject matter experts evaluating and rating the completed supplemental questionnaires. Applicant responses to the supplemental questions must demonstrate the knowledge, skills and abilities listed in the qualifications section of this announcement. The evaluation of supplemental questions may be weighted 100% of an applicant score (before residency, seniority and/or veteran points, if applicable) and may determine rank on the eligible list. If a sufficient number of quality application packets are received, the supplemental screening may be followed by a third stage and the most qualified applicants will be invited to the next stage. Meeting the minimum qualifications does not guarantee advancement to Stage III.
Stage III: The third stage may consist of an oral examination that may be preceded by a brief written exercise (weighted 100%) that will test the knowledge, skills and abilities listed in the qualifications section.
The ranked eligible list may be developed directly from the supplemental screening OR the results of Stage III. Candidates must earn a scale score of 70 in this examination process to be placed on the eligible list for employment consideration. This is a continuous recruitment; additional names of successful candidates may be added to the eligible list periodically; candidates’ names will be merged onto the existing eligible list and referred to hiring departments according to rank. Candidates who are on an active eligible list may not re-apply for the duration of the eligible list.

Applicants are required to submit criminal history information upon request after receiving a conditional offer of employment. If the requested information is not furnished in a timely manner, applicants will not qualify for further consideration and will be removed from the eligible list.

NOTICE: The City of Oakland has adopted a COVID-19 Employee Mandatory Vaccination Policy. Under the policy, all employees must, as a condition of employment: (1) report their vaccination status to the City no later than November 15, 2021; and (2) be fully vaccinated and verify that vaccination status to the City not later than November 29, 2021, unless the employee has applied for an exemption and is awaiting the City’s response or has been granted an exemption, or unless stricter State or Federal legal requirements apply. If offered employment, you will receive instructions regarding how to provide verification of vaccination or how to apply for an exemption which will be required prior to your start date. You may read the entire policy here (Download PDF reader).

The City of Oakland reserves the right to modify the selection process and date of examination as necessary to conform to administrative or business necessity. The information contained in this announcement is subject to change and does not constitute either an expressed or implied contract.
How to Apply
Apply prior to the closing time of the job announcement and allow at least two to three hours to submit your application if you are a new user on the system. APPLICATIONS ARE ACCEPTED ONLINE ONLY. You may apply and view current openings by visiting our employment opportunities webpage at: http://agency.governmentjobs.com/oaklandca/default.cfm.
If you do not have access to a computer, there are computer stations available at any City of Oakland Public Library. There are also work stations at the Human Resources Management Department, 150 Frank H. Ogawa Plaza, 2nd Floor, Oakland, CA 94612. Work stations are available during regular business hours (normally 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.). Due to current events and pandemic-related safety concerns, City facilities may be closed to the public.

Our on-line application system is provided by NeoGov. If you have problems while applying online, please contact NeoGov's Live Applicant Support at (855) 524-5627 between 6:00 AM and 5:00 PM Pacific Time, Monday - Friday. You may also call the City of Oakland Human Resources Management Department during regular business hours at (510) 238-3112 for information; however, we are unable to provide technical support for the online application system.

Date of Examination:
TBD

The City of Oakland is an EEO/ADA Employer.

The City complies with all Federal, State and local laws mandating Equal Employment Opportunities. All qualified applicants will be considered in accordance with applicable laws prohibiting discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, age, veteran status, disability, marital status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.

Title: Structural Engineer
Job Description:
Alexandria, VA
Full-time
Salary: $65,000.00 to $100,000.00 /year
This is a Full Time, Exempt position. Salary commensurate with experience. (Part time employment will be considered.)
INTRODUCTION:
Awen Solutions Group (Awen) strives to serve clients as their trusted partner, solving problems, and providing services to improve organizational performance. Awen combines the most talented subject matter experts with innovative tools to deliver the necessary solutions. Awen creates cohesive teams with diverse backgrounds, knowledge, and skills to break down barriers to success, and together, help clients reach goals more efficiently. To fulfill its mission, Awen seeks to build and enhance its most valuable resources by maximizing opportunities for its dedicated professionals. By providing direct supervision, training, and mentoring for its employees, Awen pursues the effective development of knowledge, skills, and judgment required to fulfill its unique and important mission.
We offer diverse work experiences, competitive salary and benefits including flex-time work schedule, 401(k) Plan with immediate vesting and company matching, 100% paid Medical (HMO & PPO), Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Discretionary Bonuses, Tiered Paid Time Off (PTO) starting at 15 days/year, Paid Holidays and the opportunity for advancement.
You can grow with AWEN!
This position is that of Structural Engineer (P.E.), the purpose of which is to lead our Structural Engineer Design Functions within healthcare facilities (new construction or renovation). This position is an integral component of our growing A&E Division which directly oversees and performs day-to-day oversight, design, and implementation of all Structural Engineering Tasks in support of our current projects.
Pre-Design Engineering
Conduct on-site investigations of existing Buildings
Review and verify the structure, site utilities and infrastructure to support remodel design options
Design Engineering
Work with the design team to develop multiple concepts
Create a weighted design matrix (WDM) which shall be used throughout the design period to compare design alternatives and possible trade-offs
Work with the design team to provide a full set of project drawings, showing the scope and plan for your discipline
During demolition show what will remain during construction and means of protection.
Show and identify existing conditions, sections, elevations, details, dimensions, capacities, and items to be removed.
Provide symbol sheets and explanation of detail symbols used.
Provide REVIT compatible 3D model file for all drawn elements.
Show existing conditions and how new work interfaces.
Document all calculations, computations and engineering data used to develop designs
Assist as required for Interim Life Safety / Fire Protection Plan, Phasing Plan, Security, and Environmental controls/barriers.
Show locations, layout, elevations and details of proposed building designs
Provide a copy of all calculations, computations, and engineering data used to assess design alternatives.
Create General Specifications
Understand and utilize CAD standards
Have a working knowledge of Building Codes
Have an ability to read floor plans, sections and elevations, risers, details, schedules, and specifications.
Possess strong record-keeping and organizational skills
Possess a good sense of coordination and follows through. Able to work in close contact with the entire design team.
Help review and develop project Specifications.
Provide symbol sheets and explanation of detail symbols.
Provide an investigation and explanation of any applicable regulatory/code requirements incorporated into the design. Furnish a copy of each code quoted or used in the design.
Construction Administration
Reviews and responds to RFI’s
Respond to questions that arise during the schematic study which will analyze and provide recommendations for phasing, structuring, scoping, and cost estimating.
Performs punch lists
Accountabilities:
Accountable for production of accurate technical and contract documentation for project.
Accountable for structural design activities, including consultant design activities, as well as the accuracy, cost controls, budget, reporting, and timeliness of all assigned projects and related client management.
Responsible for quality and accuracy of all structural drawing packages, exhibits and documents assembled.
Manage planning, design development, and production of working drawings and project documents.
Responsible for plan check requirements and ensure compliance with building codes and regulations.
Minimum Skills:
Proficient in AutoCAD, Revit and Photometric Software
Proficient in all Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Excel, Word)
Advanced knowledge of QA/QC process.
Thorough understanding and application of current building codes is required and ability to research and apply/incorporate into technical documents.
High degree of initiative, flexibility, and resourcefulness.
Excellent communication skills (graphic, writing, and oral)
Ability to effectively meet deadlines.
Excellent Interpersonal Skills.
Extremely organized and attentive to detail
Minimum Qualifications
Structural Engineering: 5+ years (Required)
AutoCAD and Revit: 4+ years (Required)
Minimum of 3-7 years progressive experience in management and responsibilities; or equivalent combination of education and experience (Required)
Education and Experience:
Licensed Professional Engineer (Required) (Preferably with CA PE Stamp)
Veteran Affairs, Department of Defense or Healthcare Design Knowledge (Preferred)
LEED Certification (Preferred)
Master’s degree (M.A.) or equivalent, preferred
Experience preparing construction documents using a building prototype
Experience preparing preliminary site plans
Job Category: Engineering
Job Type: Full Time
Job Location: Alexandria VA

Title: Structural Analysis Engineer

Title: Centerline - A&E Structural Engineer Level II
Job Description:
Overview:

Who We Are
Centerline Communications, LLC works with all the major wireless operators and equipment manufacturers in the U.S. and leaders in the industry ecosystem. It is a full-service operation, specializing in the development, construction and maintenance of wireless telecommunications networks. Centerline Communications, LLC’s success in the telecommunications infrastructure industry is built on a foundation of highly experienced management and staff who embrace responsibility and an unwavering commitment to clients.

Job Summary
Reporting to the Vice President of Architectural & Engineering, the Structural Engineer II will be responsible for performing structural analyses and designs for telecommunications sites. They will also be required to review engineering drawings and designs to ensure adherence to established specifications and standards. Regional travel to conduct site visits to gather structural information (including but not limited to: measuring and providing field sketches) will be required from time to time. Candidate should have experience working in the NYC DOB system and with FDNY.

Responsibilities:
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Develop antenna upgrade construction drawings.
Perform structural analyses of antenna supporting structures.
Prepare and review mapping reports.
Review drawings for structural consistency and completeness.
Understand municipal permitting and zoning requirements including NYC DOB & FDNY.
Attend site walks to obtain necessary structural information.
Conduct Special Inspections required by NYC DOB.

Competencies
Keep Track of Time on Projects/Training/Meetings/Etc.
Work with Structural Department Program Manager on training and development
Complete company required training /policy reviews in a timely manner

Physical Demands
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear
The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms.
The employee is occasionally required to sit; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
Qualifications:
Required Education and Experience
Bachelor of Science in Civil or Structural Engineering.
Professional Engineer Certificate required.
AWS Certified Welding Inspector (AWS-CWI) required.
ICC Structural Steel and Bolting Certification required.
2-5 Years of structural work experience.
Experience using AutoCAD for structural detailing.
Experience with structural analysis modeling software.
Proficient with Microsoft Office programs.

Supervisory Responsibility
None

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work
Salaried Position/Exempt Status
Time Zone: EST

Travel
Travel to local sites for job experience may be required. Travel is primarily local during the business day, although some projects may require overnight travel.

AAP/EEO Statement
Centerline Communications, LLC is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Other Duties
Please note that this description is designed to be a comprehensive overview of the job, however duties, responsibilities, activities, and physical requirements may change at any time based on the needs of the business.
The pay range for this position is $85k-110k+; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience (in addition to medical, dental, 401k and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered).

Title: Structural Engineer
Job Description:
TAI (Tourgee & Associates, Inc) provides Engineering, Management, and Technical Services to heavy industrial and manufacturing industries throughout the United States. Named by the Baltimore Better Business Journal as one of the Top-100 Private Companies, and Top-100 Fastest Growing Companies in the region for 2022. In addition, we service more than one-third of Fortune 500 companies.
Our Structural Engineering Division has an immediate opening in our Richardson, TX office for a Structural Engineer. Our Structural Division has proven capabilities in all phases of structural analysis, development and design. We support our client’s needs through the following engineering service offerings: structural design, structural analysis, structural remediation and structural inspection services.
In addition to planning, organizing, and performing detailed structural design, this individual should be capable of supervising less experienced team members. This position receives limited direction from the Division Manager and Director.
Detailed responsibilities include: performing field surveys, performing engineering design, performing engineering analysis, creating reports, back-checking design documents, interfacing with engineers and designers within TAI, attending project meetings, checking documents and reviewing of structural team calculations and designs. A Structural Engineer should also be familiar with structural drawings and documentation including preliminary, permit and construction document submittals as well as peer review of project documentation. Interfacing with Clients, Project Managers and other TAI project team members is required.
This individual will assist with preparation of proposals and budgets. Excellent communication skills both written and verbal are essential. A Structural Engineer must be able to convey the design process and structural considerations to other project team members and provide guidance to other divisions when their scope of work will an impact on the structural design or have structural implications.

Qualifications:
Minimum 5 years of engineering experience preferably in industrial, commercial, and civil design
Proficiency in concrete and steel design
Experience with structural requirements for industrial, commercial buildings and facilities
Knowledge of geotechnical requirements for industrial, commercial buildings and facilities
Knowledge of civil site engineering requirements for industrial, commercial buildings and facilities
Ability to identify resources required for a project and provide estimated times for completion of the scope
Ability to identify changes in project scope and estimate the additional resources required to complete the additional work
Proficient knowledge of applicable design codes including current editions ASCE 7 (and others), IBC, ACI 318, AISC 303 (and others) as well as locally adopted codes and standards
Understanding of OSHA requirements as relating to facility design and construction
Experience and understanding of environmental and regional design considerations such as wind speed, rainfall, ice loading, seismic design, etc.

Candidate must have proficient knowledge of the following software:
Microsoft Office applications – Word, Excel, Project and PowerPoint
AutoCAD (ability to open drawings, navigate, edit text, and print)
STAAD, RAM, RISA 3D, and other computer-based design programs

If you're interested in learning more about TAI Engineering and what made us a top-20 partner to the manufacturing sector per Engineering News Record (ENR), please visit us at www.taiengineering.com.

Title: Entry-Level Water/Wastewater Engineer
Job Description:
Take Your Design Career to the Next Level Are you ready to be challenged, make a difference, and experience professional growth in your career? Kleinfelder's Design team is looking for you! From bridge and structural engineering to civil, electrical, mechanical, and process engineering, Kleinfelder's collaborative Design Services create synergy across multiple disciplines. Step into Your New Role We are seeking an Entry-Level Water/Wastewater Engineer for our San Diego, CA office! Candidates must be interested in working in the municipal drinking water and wastewater engineering field. To qualify as a candidate, you must possess at least a B.S. in Civil or Environmental Engineering or related field. Candidates with an M.S. in the above disciplines, and experience in municipal water and wastewater infrastructure are preferred, but all motivated individuals are encouraged to apply. The selected candidate will work in our team-oriented environment, providing primarily municipal and agency clients with professional engineering services for water and wastewater infrastructure projects. The ideal candidate will exhibit:
Demonstrated experience with field utility investigations, feasibility studies, preliminary and final technical studies, hydraulic and hydrologic computer modeling, project permitting, cost estimating, specifications, public bidding, and construction administration.
Experience in the preparation of design plans and specifications, including cost estimating, scheduling and permitting
Proficiency in AutoCAD (Microstation is strongly preferred in addition)
Experience in using hydraulic and hydrologic software in different water resource applications;
Excellent organizational, communication, computer and technical writing skills.
If selected, you will work with technical teams and be expected to provide a range of drinking water and wastewater engineering services which may include:
Planning (treatment and infrastructure studies, modeling, capital improvements, asset management)
Design (process and infrastructure design, selection, sizing, placement of equipment, developing design plans and specifications)
Bidding, construction administration, other (dependent on years of experience)
Move Forward with Kleinfelder Kleinfelder has been connecting great people to the best work since 1961. We are engineers, scientists, and construction professionals providing solutions that improve our clients' transportation, water, energy, and other private infrastructure. As a responsive, cross-disciplinary team of bright, curious, and innovative problem-solvers, we are dedicated to doing the right thing, every day, on every project from over 85 offices in the US, Canada, and Australia. Connecting great people to the best work is our purpose - together, we deliver. Progress with an Employer that Values You Kleinfelder is an inclusive organization free from discrimination. We are a stronger organization when we are a diverse workforce and believe that through diversity, equity, and inclusion comes creativity, innovation, and unity. We are proud to offer the following: Benefits: Kleinfelder offers an excellent compensation and benefits package, including: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k) plan, and paid holidays. The expected salary range for the position is displayed in accordance with the California Pay Transparency Law. Final agreed upon compensation is based upon individual qualifications and experience. Salary range: $43,843 - $73,028. Career Development: We are committed to investing in the professional development of our staff, offering each employee every opportunity to grow, develop, and take control of their career paths. We support these efforts through reimbursements for continuing education as well as many of the expenses associated with trainings and certifications, and opportunities for career development through our internal Mentoring Program. Equal Opportunity: Kleinfelder is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans. (Compliant with the new VEVRAA and Section 503 rules) This position will be required to work on projects requiring full vaccination from COVID-19, and you will be required to show proof of vaccination or an acceptable exemption in order to work on the project. NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES Please note that Kleinfelder does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement, Kleinfelder will not consider or agree to payment for any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, Kleinfelder explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resume, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Kleinfelder.

Title: Associate Civil Engineer - 1
Job Description:
Everything we do at Sunrun is driven by a determination to transform the way we power our lives. We know that starts at the individual employee level. We strive to foster an environment you can thrive in through our commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging.
Overview
The Associate Civil Engineer is responsible for reviewing photovoltaic solar system designs for structural integrity and code-compliance, and providing structural analysis for a high volume of residential solar projects. Additionally, the Associate Civil Engineer will design and analyze repairs/structural upgrades as needed. This position requires excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to work across many departments from sales to installation.
Responsibilities
Review and analyze structural integrity of residential rooftop solar designs.
Required to consistently handle high production volumes efficiently while maintaining quality.
Research engineering requirements for potential new markets.
Provide Structural Engineering support for Site Technicians, Designers, Permit Coordinators, and Installers.
Provide onsite field inspections and Structural Observations Reports when requested.
Works with PE Team in taking direction and executing on special projects as needed (Engineering SOP, New Product Research, etc.).
Additional responsibilities as needed.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree (Preferably in Civil/Structural Engineering); equivalent combination of comparable engineering degree plus Experience
Minimum 1 year of PV Design and structural review experience considered.
Civil/Structural FE/EIT certification preferred.
Experience with structural code references IBC, IRC, IEBC, NDS, Etc.
AutoCAD and drafting experience.
Experience with PV Design preferred.
Can quickly learn business and how the Internal PE Team functions
Eager to learn and open to change.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent organizational and time management skills.
Professional interaction in team environments.
Strong computer skills (Google Suite, Salesforce, etc.)
Software programming/coding skills are a huge plus.
Knows when to seek oversight.
A team mentality is a must!
*

Title: Mechanical Design Engineer (Contract)
Job Description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
EAC Product Development Solutions (EAC) is a complete source for your product development needs. We provide the full suite of PTC product development software, and offer consulting, training, hardware, implementation, and engineering services to support every phase of the product development process. EAC is ready to offer our brightest ideas to ensure you enjoy the best solutions in the industry.
POSITION OVERVIEW
The Temporary Mechanical Design Engineer will be responsible for conceptual, mechanical, and detailed design of products or components of products using industry leading 3D CAD modeling programs, primarily PTC CAD tools daily. The individual will apply knowledge of engineering principles to design a wide range of products for the medical, automotive, aerospace, industrial, consumer product and potentially other industries. This role will be both individual and team based depending upon engineering workload and the scale of the given project. The engineer will be expected to facilitate and document engineering decisions and to maintain reason records thereof. The resultant designs will be subject to the review of peers and the engineering supervising prior to release to the customer.
The Temporary Mechanical Design Engineer position will work remotely for a period of 3-4 months approximately from May until August 31, 2023
RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsibilities, skills, and knowledge may be representative, but not all-inclusive of those commonly associated with the position.
Daily operate state-of-the-art design tools and processes to develop innovative and real-world capable products and components.
Collect requirements and craft Detailed Product Specifications
Maintain open and clear communication with clients during the design process to meet all design goals.
Other duties as assigned as company needs dictate.
QUALIFICATIONS
An equivalent combination of education, training and experience will be considered. Qualifications are representative but not all-inclusive of those commonly associated with the position.
2-3 years’ experience with sheet metal design.
2-3 years’ experience in plastic design.
Experience with CREO versions 6-9, Windchill PDM, and Structural Analysis preferred.
Understanding of many types of component design and manufacture.
Experience with machine design and fabrication
Must have excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
Must possess good organizational and time-management skills.
Must have ability to work with time-sensitive deadlines and meet the project and corporate goals.
Must be able to work independently with focus and discipline to achieve the customer and company goals.
Ability to perform consistently with high collaboration and output.
SCHEDULE
30 hours on average per week
Core hours 9 AM - 5 PM CST
May have additional hours outside of core hours
WORK ENVIRONMENT
Environmental or atmospheric conditions commonly associated with the performance of the functions of this job.
Ability to work in a remote environment.
PHYSICAL ABILITIES
Physical abilities that are commonly associated with the performance of the functions of this job. The physical demands described below are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.
Light sedentary office work.
NOTE: This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees may be required to follow other job-related instructions and to perform other job-related duties as requested, subject to all applicable state and federal laws. Certain job functions described herein may be subject to possible modification in accordance with applicable state and federal laws.

Title: Forensic Structural Engineer
Job Description:
Position: Forensic Structural Engineer
Location: Houston, Texas
Position Type: Full-Time
Are you looking for a rewarding position that allows you to challenge yourself and forward your career? As a Forensic Structural Engineer at Apollo BBC you’ll be responsible for managing projects and working with a team to investigate building problems, produce recommendations for repair, and potentially provide litigation support services.
You’ll have the opportunity to provide forensic building consulting services for exciting, interesting projects and receive the necessary training to enhance your skills.
Apollo BBC focuses on a diverse set of problems with commercial buildings. This position will involve several discipline sets including structures, wall assemblies, curtain walls, and roof assemblies, but would focus on building enclosure systems associated with failures and high performance buildings.
The successful candidate possesses a Bachelor of Science in Civil or Structural Engineering, excellent interpersonal and communication skills, the ability to work effectively within a team, the ability to work independently under general guidance and direction, a desire for continually increasing challenges, and an aptitude to manage projects and technical support staff.

Responsibilities
Conduct regular visits to building construction sites
Complete written reports detailing issues found in an accurate and timely manner
Manage multiple projects competently and professionally
Project related travel is required

Qualifications
Masters of Science in Architectural, Civil, or Structural Engineering
Professional licensure and accreditation preferred
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong organizational skills
Dependable and able to work without close supervision
Detail oriented with an ability to multi task
Prior to employment a background check and screening will be required.

Title: Structural Engineer I - Stress Analyst
Job Description:
If you like solving problems and working with complex materials and systems, join our amazing team! As a Structural Engineer, you will be using your skills and expertise to design, evaluate, and certify our cutting edge products and services. These cover a very wide range from advanced mission payloads and electronic systems through highly integrated aircraft to orbital and space exploration systems. You'll examine complex metallic and composite structures and systems. Your technical duties involve the design and development of new products and processes throughout the product lifecycle.

The ISR (Intelligence, Surveillance & Reconnaissance), Aviation, and Security (IAS) business area is a leader in ISR and aviation, it is a leading prime manned and unmanned aircraft systems integrator for innovative, high-performance ISR and aviation systems. Its end-to-end Command, Control, Computers, Communications and Intelligence, Surveillance & Reconnaissance (C4ISR) capabilities encompass design, integration, test, certification, ground/flight training and complete logistics support. IAS tailors solutions to customer cost, performance, and schedule requirements and designs to consistently exceed expectations – with an unrivaled record of on time and on (or under) budget deliveries. Learn more about IAS

The successful candidate:
Possesses knowledge of the principles of engineering and is learning to apply those principles to work assignments.
Acquires an understanding of professional and ethical responsibilities.
Basic proficiency in the Structural Analysis Engineering discipline such as: static stress analysis using classical hand calculations and finite element modeling
Thrives in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment
Typically works under very close supervision and work is not implemented without review.
Typically works within specific guidelines

Primary Duties:
Focuses on developing technical expertise and knowledge of relevant systems and technologies
Executes assigned tasks in a timely manner to generate data to support the goals of the program. Work products generated will be reviewed by more experienced engineers
Reads and interprets technical documentation – including mechanical drawings and vendor supplied technical documentation
Exchanges basic information with individuals in their department, such as requesting or providing information with explanation or interpretation required and has limited customer contact
Guides design in initial sizing and load path establishment
Analyzes designs generated in 3D CAD software for review and release in configuration management tool utilizing classical hand calculation methods and finite element analysis
Creates technical documentation – including structural substantiation reports, test plans, and test reports and works with approving authority to obtain approval
Coordinate with SNC Production for the installation of parts and assemblies for approved SNC designs to include design clarification and discrepancy resolution through the approval of drawing redlines, revisions, and non-conformance reports

Must-haves:
Bachelor's of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Civil Engineering or other related discipline and typically 0-2 or more years of relevant experience
Conceptual knowledge of engineering principles and practices
Basic knowledge of Computer Aided Engineering tools
Familiarity working in multi-disciplinary design and development teams
Understanding of Static and/or Dynamic Analyses

Preferred:
Familiarity with aircraft structure/construction
Familiarity with industry standard analytical methods (Niu, Bruhn, etc.)
Basic understanding of solid mechanics and material properties
Familiarity with FEMAP/NX Nastran or MSC Patran/Nastran finite element modeling software
Familiarity with Solidworks CAD software
The ability to obtain and maintain a Secret U.S. Security Clearance may be required. Learn more about the background check process for Security Clearances

This position posting will be utilized to fulfill both current and future openings.
At Sierra Nevada Corporation (SNC) we deliver customer-focused technology and best-of-breed integrations in the aerospace and defense sectors. SNC has been honored as one of the most innovative U.S. companies in space, a Tier One Superior Supplier for the U.S. Air Force, and as one of America’s fastest-growing companies. Learn more about SNC

Estimated Starting Salary Range: $68,926.06 - $94,773.33

SNC offers a generous benefit package, including medical, dental, and vision plans, 401(k) with 150% match up to 6%, life insurance, 3 weeks paid time off, tuition reimbursement, and more .

This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a Secret U.S. Security Clearance. U.S. Citizenship status is required as this position needs an active U.S. Security Clearance for employment. Non-U.S. citizens may not be eligible to obtain a security clearance. The Department of Defense Consolidated Adjudications Facility (DoD CAF), a federal government agency, handles the adjudicative aspects of the security clearance eligibility process for industry applicants. Adjudicative factors which affect the outcome of the eligibility determination include, but are not limited to, allegiance to the U.S., foreign influence, foreign preference, criminal conduct, security violations and illegal drug use. Title: Entry-level Staff Engineer (Structural and Forensics)
Job Description:
NOVA Engineering is seeking an entry-level Structural Engineer to join our Forensics Engineering group in Buford, GA. The primary work mix for this Structural Engineer position includes the following: evaluating distressed structures, building envelope evaluation, performing materials sampling and nondestructive testing, structural analysis, modeling, designing repairs, report preparation and project management.

Management of projects from start to finish.

Mentor and develop junior engineering staff

The successful candidate must have:
Bachelors Degree in Civil, Structural, or Architectural Engineering
EIT Certification or able to obtain certificaiton within 3 months of employment
Proficiency in AutoCAD is preferred, but not required
Knowledge of building codes: IBC & IRC
